Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Nexeo Belgium is looking for a Medior/Senior Data Scientist – Generative AI to join the Artificial Intelligence Tribe of one of the top financial institutions in Belgium.




As part of the team, you will:

Design and develop AI applications (e.g., virtual assistants) to improve customer experience, empower employees, and optimize internal processes.
Apply a broad range of analytical methodologies, including Generative AI (Prompt Engineering, RAG, fine-tuning, speech-to-text, agentic applications, image generation/interpretation) and predictive AI techniques.
Leverage your expertise in Python to develop and deploy AI solutions in production using modern tools and frameworks.
Collaborate in an Agile environment with a multidisciplinary team, sharing expertise and driving innovation.
Access and analyze one of the most diverse and rich datasets in the market.
Present project outcomes directly to top management.

Your profile:

Master’s degree in a quantitative field (statistics, mathematics, engineering, or equivalent).
At least 3 years of relevant experience in Data Science and Analytics.
Strong expertise in Python, deep learning, and pre-trained models.
Experience with Generative AI frameworks (LangChain, Haystack, etc.) is a plus.
Previous experience with GenAI applications in the financial sector is an asset.
Fluent in Dutch or French, and fluent in English.
Business-oriented mindset, excellent communication skills, and ability to work in multicultural environments.
Proactive, autonomous, and able to learn quickly new techniques when needed.

Work location:

Hybrid model: 50% on-site / 50% homeworking.

We offer:

A competitive package.
The opportunity to work with cutting-edge AI technologies on impactful business cases.
A collaborative environment fostering innovation and knowledge-sharing.

Ready to shape the future of AI in the financial sector?

Apply now and join Nexeo Belgium.

#AI #GenerativeAI #DataScience #MachineLearning #FinanceJobs #Consulting #Belgium #Python

Title: Data Scientist – Transformez la mobilité de demain
Description:
Data Scientist – Transformez la mobilité de demain




Notre partenaire, une software company belge, recherche un Data Scientist dans le but de renforcer leur département IA.




Data Scientist – L’entreprise :




Notre partenaire est l’une des entreprises tech les plus innovantes de Belgique. Elle propose des solutions sur mesure à ses clients dans les domaines de la Sécurité, Mobilité, Environnement & L’analyse.




Sa technologie unique au monde lui a rapidement permis d’être leader sur le territoire belge et de se lancer à la conquête du territoire européen.




Cette entreprise à taille humaine vous permettra d’évoluer dans des équipes jeunes et dynamiques ou il fait bon vivre.




Data Scientist – Le rôle:




Premièrement, la structure aime avant tout les gens curieux, collaboratifs, désireux d'avoir un impact et qui valorisent l'innovation, l'autonomie et l'esprit d'équipe.




Deuxièmement, dans ce poste spécifique, il sera important pour vous d'avoir de l'expérience sur les points suivants : Python Data Processing & Visualisation libraries – ML & Deep Learning




L’objectif principal sera d’accélérer et d’améliorer la prise de décision des acteurs du monde de la mobilité via vos prédictions et des outils d’Intelligence Artificielle




Data Scientist – Le profil :




Vous disposez d’un Master Degree en Computer Science / Engineering
Vous avez 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer
Vous maitrisez Python et ses librairies de visualisations, Hadoop – Spark – Kafka sont un plus




Data Scientist – L’offre:




Salaire annuel allant jusque 85.000 € (en fonction de votre expérience)
Optimisation fiscal brut / net – Régime de droit d’auteur
Assurance groupe & Hospitalisation
Frais de représentation / net – 100 €
Véhicule de fonction + carte essence ou Budget Mobilité
Bénéficiez d’horaires flexibles (2/3 jours de télétravail/semaine)
Participez à des Teams Building de folie
Avoir des perspectives d’évolutions et prendre le Lead sur une équipe ML
Rejoignez une structure en pleine expansion et remplie d’ambition




If you are interested, even if you don’t match 100% of the required skills - please apply - your application is welcome !

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
B.E.S. (Business and Engineering Solutions) is looking for a Data Scientist to coordinate, define and execute the data activities in the automotive sector.







Your responsabilities :

You implement feature engineering techniques to extract main features from events, manoeuvres, and trips,
You support study of driver behaviour based on time series big data and aggregated demographics,
You support Link Driver Behaviour comprehensive groups with market and persona data,
You provide support in the application of data science methods in study cases,
You analyse customer survey data and market data,




Your profile :

You have a Master degree,
You are fluent in English (written and spoken), French is a real asset,
You have 1 year of experience (internship, apprenticeship) in data,
You are interested in working in a sector at the heart of innovation,
You have knowldege in Python,
You have experience with big data,
You can work autonomously.




What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?




Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances OR a VIE!
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team !!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist – AI & Microsoft Services




Location: Brussels (Hybrid – 2 days onsite, 3 remote)

Start: ASAP | Type: Freelance




About the Role

We’re looking for a hands-on Data Scientist / AI Engineer to design and deliver impactful AI applications using Microsoft AI Services, Generative AI, and Copilot. You’ll take on diverse business challenges: from building virtual assistants to automating internal workflows, and turn them into production-ready solutions that enhance customer experiences, empower employees, and optimise processes.




This role is self-directed and innovation-focused. You’ll work with techniques such as Prompt Engineering, RAG, fine-tuning, speech-to-text, image generation & interpretation, and classical ML/statistical methods. You’ll collaborate closely with business stakeholders and technical teams, communicate results directly to leadership, and contribute to reusable AI frameworks in an Agile environment.




Key Responsibilities

Design and implement AI solutions using Microsoft AI ecosystem tools (Azure AI, Azure Machine Learning, Cognitive Services, Copilot)
Apply a mix of Generative AI and Predictive AI methods to real-world use cases
Build proof-of-concepts and evolve them into scalable, production-ready solutions in Python
Share insights with the team and help define AI best practices
Present results and recommendations to senior stakeholders




What You Bring

Strong Python and AI/ML development skills
Experience deploying AI applications into production
Knowledge of Generative AI techniques, with the ability to quickly learn new ones
Problem-solving mindset and ability to turn ideas into deliverables
Clear communicator, able to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Languages: English + French or Dutch

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🔍 Looking for your next step in Data Science?

Want to use your skills to make a real impact, grow in a supportive environment, and enjoy a healthy work-life balance? We’re looking for a versatile and driven Data Scientist to help us turn data into actionable insights that support smarter decisions across the organization.

💡 What you’ll do:

Build and implement advanced analytics and AI solutions for real business challenges
Work with large, sensitive datasets, while ensuring compliance with data regulations
Translate data into clear, strategic insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate closely across departments — from business to IT
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in AI, GenAI, and data science

👤 What you bring:

A few years of experience in data science or a related field
Strong skills in Python, SQL, and standard data tools
A proactive, analytical mindset and strong problem-solving skills
Clear communication skills in both technical and business contexts
A natural curiosity, team spirit, and eagerness to learn

✨ What we offer:

A varied, impactful role with room to grow through training, coaching, internal mobility, and innovation projects
A flexible hybrid work model (up to 3 days remote), with a great Brussels-based office location
A competitive gross salary with a wide range of extra-legal benefits, including:
▫️ Full insurance package (hospitalization, outpatient care, income protection, pension)
▫️ Meal and eco vouchers
▫️ Internet and homeworking allowance
▫️ Mobility budget or company car
▫️ Year-end premium, collective bonus, and individual performance bonus
▫️ Flexible reward plan tailored to your preferences
▫️ Up to 34 vacation days and flexible working hours

This is more than just a job — it’s a place where your data skills can make a difference, and where your growth and well-being truly matter.

📩 Sound like your kind of challenge? Let’s connect.

#DataScience #AI #Analytics #Hiring #CareerGrowth #HybridWork #MachineLearning #DataJobs #BrusselsJobs #NowHiring

Title: Junior Data Scientist & AI (€50k-€80k) - EU
Description:
Our goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,500,000 users come true!




We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals (with 0 to 3 years of experience) who aspire to join our team across Europe. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a relevant role becomes available and your profile matches our requirements.




For all Junior positions in the Tech Field, we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k) in the EU Region, you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work in one of our offices or fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.




We are looking only for Junior profiles, with 0 to 3 years of experience.

--




Responsibilities:

Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:

Implementation of Machine Learning Algorithms: You will have the opportunity to implement and test machine learning algorithms, contributing to the development of intelligent solutions for business challenges. Specifically, working alongside our tech team, you will be involved in Joinrs AI: our Artificial Intelligence model that assists our community in finding employment.
Data Analysis and Modeling: You will participate in data analysis, developing predictive models and contributing to provide meaningful insights to enhance business decisions.
Data Visualization: You will learn to create clear and informative data visualizations to effectively communicate complex results to various stakeholders. In particular, you will create interactive dashboards to showcase data and Key Performance Indicators (Data Visualization) to the team, clients, investors, and all key stakeholders.
Optimization of Business Processes: You will collaborate in identifying and optimizing business processes through the application of data-driven solutions.
Participation in Technological Brainstorming Sessions: You will be involved in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas and contribute to identifying new opportunities in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
Continuous Training and Updates on the Latest Trends: You will have access to continuous training programs to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in the fields of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.




--




What We Offer:

Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:

Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.
Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.
Team building & fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.
Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.
Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.
Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.
Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.

--




Who We Are:

Our mission is to support every recent graduate and junior professional in achieving their goals, helping them start their careers with optimism and a clear vision for their future.




We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.




Our community includes over 1,500,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we’re growing fast—join us!

--




Contract & Compensation:

For all Junior positions we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k).




Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.

--




Selection Process:

CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).

Phone Interview: The second step involves a 15-minute phone interview with our HR Manager.

Video Interview: The final step is a video interview with both the HR Manager and your future supervisor, lasting at least 45 minutes.

--




Why Join Our Team?

Social Impact: You'll have the opportunity to support our community in realizing their ambitions, as well as your own.

Successful Startup: Joinrs was selected among the top 10 startups globally at the Web Summit in Lisbon.

Exponential Personal Growth: You'll have the opportunity for exponential growth, both in hard and soft skills, thanks to a training program based on on-the-job training and online support.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are currently looking for a “Data Scientist” to strengthen the Cronos Europa team.

This position requires a maximum of 5 days per month at client offices. However, teleworking must take place within 2 hours of Brussels.

Responsabilities


Coordination and review of policy units' business needs
Definition of solutions proposed for servicing policy units' business needs
Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers
Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks
Creating, designing and developing data models
Analyse large datasets and propose approaches for optimisation of reporting
Assessment and quality control of data
Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders
Management and processing of data
Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available
Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI
Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects developed


Technical skills


Data Analytics techniques and tools
Power BI (including Power Query)
Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like Visual Basic, SQL, Other Business Intelligence tools (SAP Business Objects, QlikSense, SAS...), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Azure Data Factory...)
SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL)
Architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores
Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems


Profile


Bachelor's degree minimum
English fluent
Ability to integrate in multicultural environment, team player, discretion, integrity, problem solving


Why cronos group?

We'll propose you


An attractive salary package
A good work-life balance environment
The assurance of working in cutting-edge technologies in an entrepreneurial spirit.
The opportunity to develop your skills thanks to tailor-made training courses according to your needs
A good job in a friendly place


If you wish to integrate a dynamic structure on a human scale while working with the latest technologies, don't wait anymore and join Cronos!

  • Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like Visual Basic, SQL, Other Business Intelligence tools (SAP Business Objects, QlikSense, SAS...), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Azure Data Factory...)
  • SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL)
  • Architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree minimum
  • English fluent
  • Ability to integrate in multicultural environment, team player, discretion, integrity, problem solving

Why cronos group?

We'll propose you

  • An attractive salary package
  • A good work-life balance environment
  • The assurance of working in cutting-edge technologies in an entrepreneurial spirit.
  • The opportunity to develop your skills thanks to tailor-made training courses according to your needs
  • A good job in a friendly place

If you wish to integrate a dynamic structure on a human scale while working with the latest technologies, don't wait anymore and join Cronos!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist – Grid Optimization & AI Compliance

About Remobi:

We are Remobi – we empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-quality technical solutions delivered by high-performing, high-quality, REMOTE nearshore technology teams. Join our Remobi community to gain access to meaningful, innovative freelance projects and play a key role in shaping how companies operate!




Position Overview:

Location: Fully Remote

Role Type: Freelance/B2B/Contract

Duration: Initial 12 Months




Position Summary:

We’re hiring a Data Scientist to build and deploy reinforcement learning (RL) models that optimize real-time control of energy grid systems. This role focuses on developing scalable, responsible AI solutions that reduce emissions, support compliance, and improve operational efficiency. You’ll work with cutting-edge tools like Grid2Op, L2RPN, and ICTE, integrating your work into cloud-native environments with Python and AWS.

This position suits someone passionate about sustainability, operational AI, and solving complex, real-world challenges.




Responsibilities:

Design, train, and deploy RL models to optimize real-time grid operations.
Use open-source grid simulation platforms (Grid2Op, L2RPN, ICTE) to develop and validate models.
Ensure models comply with regulatory and sustainability standards for AI systems.
Deploy and scale models using AWS services such as SageMaker, Lambda, and S3.
Collaborate with engineers, compliance teams, and energy operations specialists.
Translate technical insights into clear communications for varied stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Proven experience with Reinforcement Learning, ideally applied to physical or control systems.
Advanced Python programming and model deployment skills.
Hands-on use of tools like Grid2Op, L2RPN, ICTE, or similar simulation environments.
Experience deploying models on AWS (SageMaker, Lambda, S3).
Familiarity with smart grid technologies or energy systems is a plus.
Understanding of AI governance, sustainability metrics, or regulatory frameworks.
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or related technical discipline.




If you’re interested in this role or know someone who might be a great fit, feel free to apply or get in touch!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US




Konecta is a leading innovative global service provider in customer management business process and digital outsourcing, with 120,000 passionate employees working in 30 languages across 4 continents and 26 countries. Focusing on the unique needs and opportunities of each industry, Konecta offers a full range of end-to-end customer management solutions – including acquisition, retention, customer service, technical support, and collection – all based on a sustainable business model. These services are built on a portfolio of world-class expertise covering customer experience and process management, digital solutions and cutting-edge technologies. Headquartered in Madrid, Konecta delivers global revenues of €2 billion with more than 500 clients, covering some of the biggest names in telecoms, energy, banking, mobility, retail, and e-commerce.




MISSION OF THE ROLE




The Data Scientist in Advisory & Professional Services plays a key role in designing and implementing generative AI solutions that solve real business problems. Working closely with senior data scientists, consultants, and engineers, this role supports the development of prototypes, PoVs, and client-facing solutions using state-of-the-art AI models, agentic frameworks and techniques. The ideal candidate combines hands-on technical ability with curiosity and the drive to create business value through data.




RESPONSIBILITIES




Technical Delivery:

Assist in designing and building Gen AI prototypes using LLMs, embeddings, RAG pipelines, and fine-tuning techniques.
Develop and test agentic workflows using frameworks like LangChain Agents, CrewAI, AutoGen, or Databricks Mosaic AI
Support feature engineering, evaluation, and testing of models in collaboration with architects and engineers.
Create clean, reusable code and Jupyter notebooks that align with internal quality and documentation standards.




Client Collaboration:

Participate in client workshops, discovery sessions, and technical validation phases.
Translate client needs into tractable data science tasks and communicate results clearly.
Collaborate with squads to continuously refine agent behavior, planning strategies, and tool integrations
Support the presentation of prototypes and findings in pre-sales and advisory engagements.




Reusability & Innovation:

Contribute to internal libraries, prompt collections, evaluation frameworks, and demo environments.
Help maintain Gen AI accelerator kits and continuously refine based on project experience.




Governance & Compliance:

Apply responsible AI principles including explainability, fairness, and auditability in project work.
Ensure alignment with the AI governance framework, especially regarding EU AI Act and data protection.




REQUIREMENTS

3–5 years of experience in data science or applied machine learning, preferably in a consulting or client-facing environment.
Hands-on experience with LLM APIs, embeddings, vector databases, and prompt engineering.
Skilled in Python and ML libraries such as LangChain, Hugging Face, scikit-learn, Pandas, and Jupyter.
Familiarity with MLOps concepts and tools like MLflow, DVC, or cloud-based model deployment (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Able to communicate clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Comfortable working with REST APIs, event-driven architectures, and integrating external tools into agent workflows
A team player with an appetite for learning, co-creation, and working in multidisciplinary squads.
Awareness of ethical AI, responsible AI practices, and data privacy guidelines.
Fluent English

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer




Location: Brussels

Type: Freelance (Daily Rate)

Duration: 6 Months, with potential extension

Start Date: ASAP




Montash has partnered with a leading organisation to deliver production-ready AI solutions, and we’re now looking to engage a freelance AI/ML Engineer with a strong focus on industrialising machine learning pipelines.




The Role:

As an AI/ML Engineer, you’ll act as the bridge between Data Science and IT Production, ensuring that ML models are not only functional but fully integrated, monitored, and scalable in a production environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Build and automate robust ML pipelines ready for production deployment
Collaborate closely with Data Scientists to translate models into scalable solutions
Support deployment with CI/CD pipelines, containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes), and infrastructure alignment
Ensure continuous monitoring, retraining, and version control of models in live environments
Drive integration of AI services with appropriate data flow, ingestion, and real-time architecture




Required Experience:

3+ years in ML engineering or related production environments
Strong hands-on skills with Python (incl. async programming & optimisation)
Experience with Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, GitLab CI/CD, and PostgreSQL
Knowledge of AI platforms, Spark, ELT/ETL tools, and data visualisation is a plus
Agile mindset with strong communication skills and stakeholder awareness
Fluent in English and ideally Dutch/French




Interested?

If you're immediately available and this sounds like the right fit, please get in touch today with your CV and availability to shaip@montash.nl

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Role: Data Scientist

Length: 6 months with possible extension

Location: Brussels

Work pattern: Hybrid (50%)







For the role you will have to:







Utilize a range of analytical methodologies (generative AI and predictive AI), including GenAI techniques & methodologies: Prompt Engineering, RAG, Fine-tuning, speech-to-text, agentic application, image generation and interpretation, and classical statistical/machine learning techniques.
Demonstrate extensive experience in programming with Python and contribute to deploying AI applications in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
Communicate the fruits of your work directly to the top management.
Access one of the richest volumes of varied data in the market and apply your skills to it.
Evolve in an environment where innovation and lean processes are praised, straight-forward communication is encouraged, and peers understand the meaning of team up.
Work with a team of colleagues in an Agile organization who are ready to collaborate and to share their experience.







Must have requirements:







You have at least 3 years of relevant experience in Data Science and Analytics.
You have at least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, such as statistics, mathematics or engineering.
Efficient with Python.
Experience with deep learning and pre trained models.
English speaking.
French OR Dutch speaking.







Nice to have:







Domino.
Git.
GenAI frameworks: Langchain, haystack etc.
GenAI experience for Finance.







If you feel like you could be suited to this role please send an up-to-date CV to Jaiden.Smith@g2recruitment.com and I will reach out.

Title: AI speelmakker - Breng AI tot leven in onze speeltuin (m/v/x)
Description:
Ben jij diegene die niet kan wachten om met AI te spelen, te experimenteren en te verbeteren? Word jij blij van slimme oplossingen die snelheid brengen en processen verbeteren? Dan zoeken wij jou als AI Speelmakker en breng AI tot leven in onze speeltuin — ons bedrijf is dé plek waar nieuwe ideeën tot leven komen!




Wat ga je doen?




Als AI Speelmakker werk je als sparringpartner voor alle afdelingen. Jij duikt samen met teams en collega’s in de dagelijkse werking en bekijkt hoe we met AI ons werk slimmer, sneller en eenvoudiger kunnen maken. Je bent de brug tussen technologie en praktijk: van het spotten van kansen tot het testen en implementeren van AI-oplossingen.


Taken


Jouw speelveld:





Je ontwikkelt en begeleidt AI-projecten in co-creatie met de afdelingen.


Je inspireert en stimuleert medewerkers om AI toe te passen in hun dagelijkse werk.


Je bent een hands-on doener: van experimenteren met AI-tools tot het realiseren van praktische toepassingen.


Je creëert korte, snelle successen én bouwt tegelijkertijd aan duurzame verbeteringen.



Vereisten


Wie ben jij?





Je bent een praktische denker die houdt van actie.


Je hebt een passie voor AI en ziet technologie als middel om het leven makkelijker te maken.


Je houdt van snelheid, verbeteringen en krijgt energie van dingen die wél werken.


Je kan schakelen tussen strategie en uitvoering en weet anderen hierin mee te nemen.


Je hebt ervaring met AI-tools en technologieën, maar belangrijker nog: je wil blijven leren en spelen.



Benefits


Wat bieden wij jou?





Een speeltuin vol kansen om jouw ideeën in de praktijk te brengen.


Samenwerking met enthousiaste teams die openstaan voor vernieuwing.


Ruimte voor experiment, creativiteit en snelheid.


Een organisatie die inzet op groei, zowel voor jou als voor zichzelf.





Zin om mee te spelen? Stuur ons jouw motivatie en vertel hoe jij onze AI-speeltuin mee vorm wil geven!

Show more

Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G’s supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    Your Advantages

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
    • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
    • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
    • Subsidized company restaurant;
    • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
    • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

    ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

    • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
    • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
    • We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

    At P&G #weseeequal

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

    We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

    Job Schedule

    Full time

    Job Number

    R000127114

    Job Segmentation

    Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
AI Data Scientist - Previous Pharma experience

Based in Europe - Hybrid/Remote

6 Month contract+




We’re seeking a contract Data Scientist with hands-on experience in Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI to join a global pharma leader driving the next wave of innovation in healthcare.




🔍 Key Responsibilities:

Design, fine-tune, and deploy LLMs (e.g. GPT, LLaMA, Claude) for use cases such as:
Literature summarisation, medical insights extraction, and automated reporting
Generative modelling for drug discovery or biomarker identification
Intelligent search across scientific publications and internal datasets
Collaborate with domain experts to ensure models are medically relevant, explainable, and compliant
Evaluate model performance and apply prompt engineering, retrieval augmentation (RAG), and fine-tuning as needed




✅ Requirements:

Proven experience applying LLMs or Gen AI in real-world environments (ideally within pharma, life sciences, or healthcare)
Strong skills in Python, ML libraries (Transformers, LangChain, Hugging Face, OpenAI APIs), and cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Familiarity with biomedical datasets, ontologies (e.g., UMLS, MeSH), or regulatory considerations is a plus
Comfortable working cross-functionally with data, science, and product teams

  • Generative modelling for drug discovery or biomarker identification
  • Intelligent search across scientific publications and internal datasets
  • Collaborate with domain experts to ensure models are medically relevant, explainable, and compliant
  • Evaluate model performance and apply prompt engineering, retrieval augmentation (RAG), and fine-tuning as needed


✅ Requirements:

  • Proven experience applying LLMs or Gen AI in real-world environments (ideally within pharma, life sciences, or healthcare)
  • Strong skills in Python, ML libraries (Transformers, LangChain, Hugging Face, OpenAI APIs), and cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
  • Familiarity with biomedical datasets, ontologies (e.g., UMLS, MeSH), or regulatory considerations is a plus
  • Comfortable working cross-functionally with data, science, and product teams

Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we’re looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it’s designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you’ll help clients unlock value from data.

We’re looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we’d love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM’s or optimization.
You’ve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You’re comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
💼Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

👨 💻Job Type: Freelance

📍Location: Europe

💼Work regime: 100% Remote

🔥Keywords: Machine learning, Python, AWS, and CI/CD pipeline




Position Overview:

As a Machine Learning Engineer at client, you will be a key player in a cross-functional team of data scientists, data engineers, analysts, and DevOps engineers across our Clinical department. You will support our data scientists, helping them operationalize machine learning models and develop high-quality, scalable API services and/or batch processes. Your work will play a critical role in our efforts to deliver predictive analytics for streamlining and accelerating clinical trial planning and execution strategies.




What you'll do:

Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to develop and deploy machine learning models.
Build and maintain scalable machine learning solutions in production.
Create secure AWS SageMaker Endpoints and ECS services to operationalize machine learning models.
Develop and maintain secure, robust, and scalable data and model pipelines.
Implement MLOps best practices regarding data and model drifts checks to ensure data quality and model accuracy and reliability via appropriate monitoring and troubleshooting.
Integrate MLOps checks and stages (e.g., automated model deployment following successful re-training) within the CI/CD pipeline.
Collaborate with other teams to define request and response formats for services and define the appropriate AWS service to use, depending on the use case.
And other duties as assigned, such as enhancing the production rigor, performance, and scalability, of the codes deployed, etc.




What you bring:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, STEM, or a related field. Equivalent professional experience will also be considered.
At least 3 years of professional experience in Machine Learning Engineering, with a focus on deploying secure and robust models in production.
Strong production-grade programming skills in Python, with experience in libraries such as scikit-learn, torch, pandas, scipy, click, and flask and/or FastAPI. (Python - )
Experience with the AWS ecosystem, specifically with services like SageMaker and ECS. (AWS, Sage Maker - )
Experience working in a cross-functional team in a professional setting.
Good understanding of software development lifecycle and practices, including Git and version control, code reviews, and functional, unit and integration testing.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.

Bonus points if you have experience in:

Experience managing the lifecycle of a machine learning model, including updates, tuning and retraining. (End to end life cycle project)
Familiarity with AWS services beyond SageMaker and ECS, such as S3, EC2, API Gateway, ECR, and DynamoDB. (Extra AWS- )
Experience working with large and complex data sets, including data cleaning and preprocessing.
Knowledge of advanced machine learning techniques (neural networks, ensemble learning, reinforcement learning, etc.) and the ability to implement them in Python.
Experience with Docker or other containerization technologies.
Familiarity with CI/CD processes, especially as applied to ML operations (MLOps), preferably with Azure DevOps.
Background or interest in pharmaceutical data, life sciences, or healthcare.




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards
Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
Crossing Hurdles is a recruitment firm. We refer top candidates to our partners working with the world’s leading AI research labs to help build and train cutting-edge AI models.




Position: Data Science Expert – AI Research

Type: Hourly Contract

Compensation: $70–$100/hour

Location: Remote

Duration: 5–6 weeks initially (with potential for extension)

Commitment: Part-time (~20 hrs/week, flexible)




Role Responsibilities

Evaluate AI-generated data analysis for quality, accuracy, and relevance.
Conduct statistical analysis and modelling for both specific and open-ended prompts.
Design prompts and create detailed rubrics for reward modelling and evaluation.
Produce gold-standard responses, including data visualizations, explanatory notes, and executable Python code.
Translate data science reasoning, decision-making, and expertise into gradable criteria for AI agents.




Requirements

Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent, OR 2+ years of relevant industry experience.
Proficiency in Python data science libraries (e.g., pandas, numpy, scikit-learn).
Strong understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical modelling, and machine learning principles.
Ability to identify patterns and trends in complex datasets and communicate insights clearly.
Excellent analytical and data-driven writing skills.




P.S. – Accept the CrossingHurdles referral invite pop-up during the application process so we can keep you posted and help you with any issues or questions.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist for one of my clients in the advertising sector. You will play a key role to the company acting as a data advisor inside the company. Wanna know more?




Here are your missions inside the role :

Develop predictive models to forecast campaign performance.
Create recommendation engines
Design qualitative and quantitative scoring frameworks for campaign evaluation.
Build and maintain end-to-end ML pipelines, from training to deployment and monitoring.
Collaborate closely with product and backend teams.
Communicate insights and results effectively to non-technical stakeholders.




Here is the ideal profile :

Around 4 years' experience as a Data Scientist
Great experience in statistics modelling
Can build a ML pipeline from A to Z
Speaks French and English




Want to know more? You just need to apply!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer – 12 Months

Location: Brussels Hybrid (50% on-site) | Sector: Banking | Start: ASAP




A major banking institution is seeking a Freelance Machine Learning Engineer to help industrialize AI solutions by developing production-grade pipelines and ensuring seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.




Role Overview

You’ll collaborate with data scientists and IT teams to deliver scalable, reliable, and automated ML services. This includes designing infrastructure-aware solutions, automating workflows, and ensuring robust integration with existing systems.




Key Responsibilities

Co-design ML solutions with data scientists, taking production constraints into account
Automate and deploy ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD best practices
Implement model and data versioning, testing frameworks, and performance monitoring
Act as a technical bridge between AI teams and IT operations for deployment and maintenance
Ensure models are monitored, retrained when needed, and integrated with business metrics




Mandatory Skills

4+ years of experience in ML engineering or related roles
Strong Python development and CI/CD experience (e.g., GitLab CI)
Hands-on with containerization/virtualization (Docker, VMs)
Proficient in data/model/code versioning and dependency management
Experience with PostgreSQL and related tooling
Fluent in English; working proficiency in French or Dutch is a PLUS
Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and collaborative delivery




Nice to Have

Familiarity with Spark, ETL/ELT workflows, and data flow orchestration
Knowledge of legacy systems integration and hybrid infrastructure
Experience with model compression, performance tuning, or data visualization tools

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sirris is looking for a Data Scientist for the Data & AI for Industry team. This position, offers the opportunity to work on a variety of topics as part of collaborative and multidisciplinary R&D projects to help companies realize AI and data-driven innovations.

Being part of small project teams, you work on industrially driven application-oriented research projects in the field of data innovation and AI.
You collaborate with our industrial and research partners to develop data-driven solutions to real-world problems in many diverse application domains such as renewable energy, digital industry, mobility, safety and security, etc. This includes supporting companies in defining, setting up and evaluating their research and innovation roadmap, while being closely involved in the subsequent project implementation.
You build an (inter)national knowledge network within the industry, the research community and with Sirris' partners, and contribute to (inter)national multi-party R&D projects in the field of data innovation and AI.
You give valuable input for new project proposals with companies and research partners.
You build knowledge about the latest technological developments in research and industry and contribute to the organization of dissemination events towards companies to spread those insights to the industry.
As an AI ambassador, you facilitate cross-domain internal collaboration with our experts from other technology disciplines with the goal of adopting AI expertise into those teams.

In addition, there is always an interesting challenge ahead!




Your profile:

You have a PhD or Master's degree in Computer Science or in a related technical discipline.
You have a first experience (between 1 and 3 years) in the field of data innovation & AI, either in academia, in industry or in an industrially related R&D environment.
You have hands-on knowledge of state-of-the-art ML/AI technologies, environment.
You are familiar with one of the following tools: statistical and machine learning tools in Python such as scikit-learn, Pandas, Tensorflow or PyTorch, etc., well-known development technologies such as git, Docker, Jupyter, etc.
You enjoy sharing your AI expertise with other colleagues.
To fit into our collaborative and international environment, you are creative, dynamic and can work independently yet transparently with colleagues. In addition, you are also a strong team player, both with colleagues and external partners. Individual and team problem solving is crucial in this position.
You see the value of a multidisciplinary approach, working across technologies and industries.
You enjoy collaborating with industry and transforming research results into services.
You enjoy presenting (preliminary) results in a tangible way and you demonstrate pedagogical skills by sharing knowledge with industry through workshops, seminars, master classes and social media.
You have good communication skills and are fluent in English, allowing you to formulate arguments and reasoning clearly. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.
And above all: you learn quickly, stay focused on your further development and on improving and innovating in a constantly changing and fast-growing environment.

Our offer:

At Sirris, innovation and collaboration are key. You will work in an environment where technological progress and sustainability go hand in hand. Together we make companies ready for the future.
An exciting and unique position within a dynamic and innovative team.
The opportunity to work with leading companies and technology experts who are at the heart of the industrial fabric in Belgium.
A stimulating environment where you can further develop your expertise.
Flexible working hours and the opportunity to work in one of our offices in Belgium or partially from home.
A competitive salary package with fringe benefits.




Interested?

Send your CV and cover letter via our online application tool. Would you like more information about the position? Do not hesitate to contact Franne Godderis.




Together we build the innovations of tomorrow!




Sirris is committed to an inclusive approach to recruitment and selection, where every candidate is treated equally regardless of age, gender, origin, religion, or other personal characteristics.

Unfortunately, we cannot support international relocation in our onboarding process.

Title: Data Science Manager AI
Description:
In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.




What is the job about?

Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutionsGathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…




Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch and English is required. (French is a plus)




We offer

As a certified Top Employer we offer:

An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.




Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:

You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals




Main Qualifications

Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing




Top reasons to work with us:

Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Cloud Systems (GCP)




We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with experience deploying and scaling models on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You’ll work closely with engineering teams to implement and maintain cloud-based ML solutions that are secure, scalable, and aligned with business goals.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy ML models on GCP
Build and maintain cloud infrastructure using best practices
Troubleshoot deployment and infrastructure issues
Improve performance, security, and scalability of existing systems
Collaborate on cloud strategy and architecture
Educate teams on cloud tools and technologies




Required Skills

Experience as a Machine Learning
Strong knowledge of GCP (Compute Engine, Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, etc.)
Programming skills in Python, Java, Go, or Node.js
Proficiency with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and CI/CD tools (Cloud Build, Azure Pipelines)
Understanding of cloud security (IAM, encryption, container security)
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code and automation
GCP certifications preferred

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Developer | Freelance / FTE | Leuven (Hybrid)

We are seeking an AI Developer to join our client’s team, focusing on computer vision and image recognition solutions for global terminal automation. You will design, build, and optimize deep learning models to support their products.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize AI models for image and video analysis
Write and maintain production-ready code for AI-driven applications
Integrate AI solutions into existing software systems
Validate and test models to ensure scalability, performance, and reliability
Collaborate with R&D to explore and implement new AI concepts
Contribute to technical documentation and knowledge sharing

Experience

Master’s degree in computer science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or related field
3+ years of hands-on experience in AI development
Strong programming skills in Python and C/C++
Analytical problem-solver with strong communication skills in Dutch and English




This is a role 2 days onsite, ASAP start and can offer a 6-month freelance contract or FTE position. Contact us for more information & Interview times!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About

A precision medicine startup is building a team to apply cutting-edge AI to immune-mediated diseases, transforming research into real-world clinical solutions. The role involves developing and deploying LLM- and RAG-powered systems that drive decision-making in diagnostics, treatment, and drug development.

Responsibilities


Model Development: Design and optimise transformer-based models for clinical, transcriptomic, or histology data, focusing on pretraining, fine-tuning, and large-scale benchmarking.
ML Infrastructure: Build scalable ML pipelines and deploy models with MLOps best practices (versioning, monitoring, retraining).
Data Scaling: Convert raw data into scalable, deep learning–ready loaders for millions of datapoints.


Requirements:


Master’s or PhD in ML, Computer Science, or related field
3+ years with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX)
Strong Python skills; experience with production ML (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP/Azure)
MLOps/DevOps: ML pipelines (e.g., Kubeflow, MLflow), Git, CI/CD, IaC
Experience in GPU programming, distributed training, and model optimisation


NOTE: VISA SPONSORSHIP IS NOT PROVIDED.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?




Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimise rebates, and drive better value.




As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.




We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimising simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.




At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.




Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such LangChain, LangGraph.
Backend development experience with frameworks like FastAPI, Django, or Flask.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with databases, API design, and microservices architecture.
Understanding of MLOps practices, model versioning, and CI/CD for ML systems.




What we offer:

Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Location:

Ghent & Brussels




What does your role involve?

Are you passionate about AI and eager to work with cutting-edge Microsoft technologies? We are looking for a Junior / Medior AI Engineer for an innovative organization in full growth. You'll join a dynamic environment where curiosity, initiative, and direct impact on business use cases are highly valued.




What you will do:

Design and implement AI solutions using Microsoft AI services (Azure AI, Azure ML, Cognitive Services)
Integrate models into Microsoft Fabric and data pipelines
Build proof-of-concepts and scale them into production-ready solutions
Identify new opportunities for AI across the business
Stay up-to-date with emerging Microsoft AI capabilities and share insights
Create reusable frameworks and document your work for future use




Who you are:

Experienced in AI development with Microsoft technologies
Skilled in Python and familiar with data engineering workflows
Interested in or experienced with Microsoft Fabric
Independent, curious, and solution-oriented
Able to translate abstract ideas into concrete solutions
Comfortable communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Solid background in Data Engineering (ETL/ELT)




What to expect:

Market-competitive salary with additional benefits.
Room for initiative within a dynamic, innovative company.




Ready to shape the future of AI?

Get in touch with us today!




More information?

Do you have any questions about this role or the application process? Feel free to contact Sophie Stroobants at +32 468 57 40 83 or send an email to Sophie@syfco.be.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist

3 month contract (extensions likely)

Remote (Europe)

500 to 550 USD per day




We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist to join our clients team for an initial 3 month contract. You will be transforming unstructured customer data into actionable insights, leveraging advanced AI/ML techniques and Large Language Models.




Skills needed;

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
5+ years of experience working with Natural Language Processing and text mining.
ML model development (feature engineering, model training, evaluation, and deployment).
Python or R.
Power BI (data modelling and integration, including creating dashboards and reports).
REST APIs (integrating and interacting with large language models).




Preferred Skills;

Large Language Models (Google Gemini).
Google Cloud Platform for deploying and managing AI/ML solutions.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Based in Belgium)
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!

At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of data-driven decisions?




About the job

🤠 What you’ll be doing

Lead the design and implementation of advanced machine learning models to solve high-impact business challenges
Architect and build robust, scalable data pipelines and data-driven solutions
Drive exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, correlations, and strategic insights
Develop and maintain complex predictive models, recommendation engines, and optimization algorithms
Translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for business leaders
Validate, monitor, and continuously improve model performance in production environments
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and business stakeholders, to ensure data quality and alignment with business goals
Mentor and guide junior data scientists, fostering technical excellence within the team
Play a strategic role in shaping Movify’s data science vision, methodologies, and best practices







🤓 Skills & qualifications

5+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar advanced analytics role
Expert proficiency in Python or R, with a strong command of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Deep expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) and experience deploying models in production
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large, complex datasets in real-world environments
Solid background in statistics, probability, and hypothesis testing, with the ability to design rigorous experiments
Practical experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control tools (e.g., Git)
Exceptional ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including C-level audiences
A strategic, proactive mindset with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Fluent in FR or NL + excellent command of English
A genuine passion for transforming data into business value and driving strategic decision-making







😍 Movify Offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology, data, and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular activities and celebrations to keep the energy high
