  • Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large, complex datasets in real-world environments
  • Solid background in statistics, probability, and hypothesis testing, with the ability to design rigorous experiments
  • Practical experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control tools (e.g., Git)
  • Exceptional ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including C-level audiences
  • A strategic, proactive mindset with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Fluent in FR or NL + excellent command of English
  • A genuine passion for transforming data into business value and driving strategic decision-making



😍 Movify Offers

  • Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology, data, and business
  • Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
  • A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
  • A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
  • Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
  • Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
  • State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
  • A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
  • Regular activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).

At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!

Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization’s infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.


Requirements

Education


Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise


Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.


Soft Skills


Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency


Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.


Why Joining Us?


You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.
Show more

Title: GEN AI and Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MUST HAVE SKILLS

Bachelor's or master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field. ·
Experience on Agentic AI/ Frameworks · Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, SQL/NoSQL etc. ·
Build analytical approach based on business requirements, then develop, train, and deploy machine learning models and AI algorithms ·
Exposure to GEN AI models such as OpenAI, Google Gemini, Runway ML etc. ·
Experience in developing and deploying AI/ML and deep learning solutions with libraries and frameworks, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, OpenCV and/or Keras. ·
Knowledge of math, probability, and statistics. · Familiarity with a variety of Machine Learning, NLP, and deep learning algorithms. ·
Exposure in developing API using Flask/Django. ·
Good experience in cloud infrastructure such as AWS, Azure or GCP · Exposure to Gen AI, Vector DB/Embeddings, LLM (Large language Model).




Skills (good to have)

Experience with MLOps: MLFlow, Kubeflow, CI/CD Pipeline etc.
Good to have experience in Docker, Kubernetes etc
Exposure in HTML, CSS, Javascript/JQuery, Node.js, Angular/React Experience in Flask/Django is a bonus.




Responsibilities

Collaborate with software engineers, business stake holders and/or domain experts to translate business requirements into product features, tools, projects, AI/ML, NLP/NLU and deep learning solutions. ·
Develop, implement, and deploy AI/ML solutions. ·
Preprocess and analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights. ·
Evaluate, validate, and optimize AI/ML models to ensure their accuracy, efficiency, and generalizability. ·
Deploy applications and AI/ML model into cloud environment such as AWS/Azure/GCP.
Monitor and maintain the performance of AI/ML models in production environments, identifying opportunities for improvement and updating models as needed. ·
Document AI/ML model development processes, results, and lessons learned to facilitate knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients. You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels. 02

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as: data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more

  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar

  • Willingness to travel up to 50%
  • Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist.
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Description Du Poste

Dans l'équipe AI&Analytics Solutions, nous voulons nous assurer que nous plaçons la prise de décision intelligente (augmentation humaine ou automatisée) au premier plan de nos processus/parcours en établissant une culture de données et d’expérimentation qui pourrait finalement devenir un avantage concurrentiel dans le monde en rapide évolution d’aujourd’hui.

Avez-vous une passion pour découvrir des insights à partir de données et les transformer en solutions impactantes ? Êtes-vous enthousiaste à l'idée de créer de la valeur commerciale à partir de données ?

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist dans notre équipe, vous allez :

• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre et formuler leurs défis en tant que problèmes analytiques.

• Appliquer le machine learning, les méthodes statistiques et les techniques d’optimisation pour développer des solutions innovantes qui impactent l'entreprise.

• Concevoir, construire et évaluer des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs, en assurant leur fiabilité et robustesse.

• Diriger le cycle de vie complet des produits ML : de l'idéation et du prototypage à la mise en production et à l’évaluation continue.

• Collaborer avec d’autres Data Scientists pour partager des connaissances, bonnes pratiques, et améliorer continuellement nos méthodologies.

• Garantir la qualité et la performance de vos solutions par des tests rigoureux et une surveillance continue après déploiement.

• Contribuer à notre communauté data science en développant des ressources réutilisables, en partageant votre expertise et en participant à des initiatives d’innovation.

Profil

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist, vous avez :

• Au moins 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist/ML Engineer ou dans un rôle analytique similaire.

• Un master dans un domaine pertinent (ex. Mathématiques appliquées, Statistiques, Data Science, Physique, Informatique).

• Une solide connaissance pratique du machine learning, des statistiques et des techniques d’optimisation, avec une expérience concrète dans leur application à des problèmes réels. Expérience dans le développement, l’évaluation et le déploiement de solutions data science de bout en bout.

• Maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques data science courantes.

• Familiarité avec les environnements de cloud computing.

• Excellentes compétences en communication, capables d’expliquer des concepts complexes à des audiences techniques et non techniques.

• Maîtrise de l’anglais, ainsi que du French ou Dutch.

Et vous êtes également :

• Passionné par la résolution de problèmes d’affaires avec des données et de l’analytics.

• Orienté résultats, capable de concilier excellence technique et besoins business.

• Curieux et désireux d’apprendre et d’expérimenter continuellement avec de nouvelles techniques.

• Collaboratif et capable de prospérer en équipe.

• Proactif, analytique et orienté solutions.

AXA souhaite refléter la diversité de la société dans laquelle nous vivons et mène donc depuis des années une politique active en faveur de la diversité, de la non-discrimination et de l'égalité des chances. Dans ce cadre, nous garantissons un suivi égal et un accès équitable au recrutement, indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, du contexte culturel, du handicap, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou d'autres caractéristiques.

AXA Belgique

Nous sommes plus de 3000 employés, travaillant dans nos bureaux modernes situés à Bruxelles, Anvers, Eupen et Liège. Nous servons 3 millions de clients en partenariat avec 3200 courtiers et nous sommes fiers d’être le premier assureur auto du pays. Notre ambition est de ne pas seulement être un payeur, mais plutôt un véritable partenaire pour nos clients.

Nos quatre valeurs principales nous poussent chaque jour à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes pour nos clients, tout en collaborant efficacement avec nos collègues: Customer First, Integrity, Courage et One AXA

Chez AXA, nous rejetons toute forme de discrimination déloyale ou illégale. Plus d’informations sur notre politique de Diversité et d’Inclusion.

Ce que nous vous offrons

Une rémunération et des avantages en lien avec votre travail

Vous bénéficierez d’un salaire compétitif, complété éventuellement d’un bonus discrétionnaire lié au résultat personnel et d’un bonus collectif, avec des chèques-repas, des écochèques, du remboursement total des transports en commun et un plan cafétaria.

Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur

Vous bénéficierez d’une assurance pension et d’une assurance hospitalisation et soins ambulatoires (également à un tarif préférentiel pour les membres de votre ménage) ainsi que d’une réduction allant jusqu'à 30 % sur nos autres produits d'assurance.

Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves

Un horaire flexible de 35 heures par semaine, 36 jours de congé par an pour vous ressourcer, ainsi que la possibilité de travailler à la maison jusqu'à 3 jours par semaine.

Vous bénéficierez de cours de sport au travail, de programmes de bien-être pour les employés et de formations, afin de vous maintenir en pleine forme, tant physiquement que mentalement.
Show more

• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre et formuler leurs défis en tant que problèmes analytiques.

• Appliquer le machine learning, les méthodes statistiques et les techniques d’optimisation pour développer des solutions innovantes qui impactent l'entreprise.

• Concevoir, construire et évaluer des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs, en assurant leur fiabilité et robustesse.

• Diriger le cycle de vie complet des produits ML : de l'idéation et du prototypage à la mise en production et à l’évaluation continue.

• Collaborer avec d’autres Data Scientists pour partager des connaissances, bonnes pratiques, et améliorer continuellement nos méthodologies.

• Garantir la qualité et la performance de vos solutions par des tests rigoureux et une surveillance continue après déploiement.

• Contribuer à notre communauté data science en développant des ressources réutilisables, en partageant votre expertise et en participant à des initiatives d’innovation.

Profil

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist, vous avez :

• Au moins 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist/ML Engineer ou dans un rôle analytique similaire.

• Un master dans un domaine pertinent (ex. Mathématiques appliquées, Statistiques, Data Science, Physique, Informatique).

• Une solide connaissance pratique du machine learning, des statistiques et des techniques d’optimisation, avec une expérience concrète dans leur application à des problèmes réels. Expérience dans le développement, l’évaluation et le déploiement de solutions data science de bout en bout.

• Maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques data science courantes.

• Familiarité avec les environnements de cloud computing.

• Excellentes compétences en communication, capables d’expliquer des concepts complexes à des audiences techniques et non techniques.

• Maîtrise de l’anglais, ainsi que du French ou Dutch.

Et vous êtes également :

• Passionné par la résolution de problèmes d’affaires avec des données et de l’analytics.

• Orienté résultats, capable de concilier excellence technique et besoins business.

• Curieux et désireux d’apprendre et d’expérimenter continuellement avec de nouvelles techniques.

• Collaboratif et capable de prospérer en équipe.

• Proactif, analytique et orienté solutions.

AXA souhaite refléter la diversité de la société dans laquelle nous vivons et mène donc depuis des années une politique active en faveur de la diversité, de la non-discrimination et de l'égalité des chances. Dans ce cadre, nous garantissons un suivi égal et un accès équitable au recrutement, indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, du contexte culturel, du handicap, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou d'autres caractéristiques.

AXA Belgique

Nous sommes plus de 3000 employés, travaillant dans nos bureaux modernes situés à Bruxelles, Anvers, Eupen et Liège. Nous servons 3 millions de clients en partenariat avec 3200 courtiers et nous sommes fiers d’être le premier assureur auto du pays. Notre ambition est de ne pas seulement être un payeur, mais plutôt un véritable partenaire pour nos clients.

Nos quatre valeurs principales nous poussent chaque jour à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes pour nos clients, tout en collaborant efficacement avec nos collègues: Customer First, Integrity, Courage et One AXA

Chez AXA, nous rejetons toute forme de discrimination déloyale ou illégale. Plus d’informations sur notre politique de Diversité et d’Inclusion.

Ce que nous vous offrons

Une rémunération et des avantages en lien avec votre travail

Vous bénéficierez d’un salaire compétitif, complété éventuellement d’un bonus discrétionnaire lié au résultat personnel et d’un bonus collectif, avec des chèques-repas, des écochèques, du remboursement total des transports en commun et un plan cafétaria.

Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur

Vous bénéficierez d’une assurance pension et d’une assurance hospitalisation et soins ambulatoires (également à un tarif préférentiel pour les membres de votre ménage) ainsi que d’une réduction allant jusqu'à 30 % sur nos autres produits d'assurance.

Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves

Un horaire flexible de 35 heures par semaine, 36 jours de congé par an pour vous ressourcer, ainsi que la possibilité de travailler à la maison jusqu'à 3 jours par semaine.

Vous bénéficierez de cours de sport au travail, de programmes de bien-être pour les employés et de formations, afin de vous maintenir en pleine forme, tant physiquement que mentalement.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer – EMEA (Remote)

Location: Fully Remote (considering people in EU, Serbia, and Armenia)

Type: Permanent

Salary: $6,000 per month (flexible)

Interview Process: 4 stages




We’re working with an ambitious global technology company building AI and ML solutions that push the boundaries of what’s possible. This role sits within a highly skilled, cross-functional engineering team focused on deploying advanced LLMs, RAG architecture, and agentic systems into production. You’ll work hands-on with the latest AI technologies while shaping the technical approach for high-impact projects.




What you'll do:




Design and deploy ML models from scratch and improve existing systems
Work closely with engineering, data science, and product teams to deliver production-ready solutions
Monitor live ML systems for performance and reliability
Document processes, pipelines, and models to high standards




What you’ll need:




Strong experience with LLMs in production, RAG architecture, and agentic systems
Proficiency in Python, Docker, and data pipelines
Experience with NLP, recommendation engines, or similar applications
Cloud experience (AWS preferred, ideally AWS Bedrock)
Experience with GenAI frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, etc..)
4-5 years experience within MLE for Senior Level




Bonus points for:

Familiarity with Spark/Dask
Hands-on AWS tools like SageMaker, ECR, EMR, S3, or Lambda




📩 Interested? Message me here or email mmatysik@trg-uk.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At The Stepstone Group, we have a simple yet very important mission: The right job for everyone. Using our data, platform, and technology, we create opportunities for jobseekers and companies around the world to find a perfect match in fair and equitable way. With over 20 brands across 30+ countries, we strive for fair and unbiased hiring. Join our team of 4,000+ employees and be part of reshaping the labour market and becoming the world's leading job platform. Join our team and you'll be responsible for our recommender systems and search algorithms, building the core infrastructure that powers millions of meaningful connections. Working in the Search & Match domain, you will be focusing on deploying and scaling machine learning models, particularly large language models (LLMs). You will collaborate with data scientists to make sure our models are efficient and can be properly optimized for cost and performance. You will work with software engineers to set up modern machine learning pipelines ensuring high operational standards. If you'd like to make a difference by maintaining cutting-edge, scalable machine learning infrastructure that brings the right people to the right jobs, then we'd love to hear from you! You will play a vital role as we reimagine the labour market to make it work for everybody. Your responsibilities: Collaborate with data scientists, ML Engineers, and backend engineers within an Agile environment Deploy and scale ML models, particularly large language models (LLMs) Build and maintain scalable pipelines and services to support real-time ML applications Maintain and improve recommender systems Build and work with modern API and microservices architectures Strong foundation in Python Experience with machine learning, familiar with Huggingface, Pytorch, and similar ML tools and packages Familiarity with deploying and scaling ML models in the cloud, particularly with AWS and SageMaker Understanding of DevOps processes and tools: CI/CD, Docker, Terraform, and monitoring/observability Bonus: experience with vector databases, semantic search, or event-driven systems like Kafka We're a community here that cares as much about your life outside work as how you feel when you're with us. Because your job shouldn't take over your life, it should enrich it. Here are some of the benefits we offer: 29 Vacation Days (20 + 9 recovery days as we work 39h/week instead of 38) Hybrid Working Model Group Insurance (Life, Pension & Disability) Hospital Insurance Lunch Vouchers Eco Cheques Flexible Compensation Plan Ongoing Development 2 Volunteering Days Fitness Classes and Studio 24/7 Employee Assistance Program Free Parking and public transport ticket (Company cars and fuel card for Key Account Managers and Managers) Drinks and snacks Access to corporate benefits app Home Office Allowance Our commitment Equal opportunities are important to us. We believe that diversity and inclusion at The Stepstone Group are critical... Title: Python Engineer – HFT – fully remote - up to $150,000 Salary + Bonus
Description:
Your Python code could move millions in seconds.




Most Python roles are about building applications. This one is about building trading systems that make split-second decisions in global markets.




You’ll be helping to power the next generation of trading infrastructure, designing and building scalable, high-performance microservices all within a fast-paced environment. The other aspects will be to work closely with the wider team, collaborating with traders and other engineers to turn ideas into reality.




There are lots of projects going on but your initial focus will be helping to expand the exchange connectivity by adding new markets, building Python-based microservices for trading operations and developing features for funding rate prediction.




You’re going to ideally be coming from a HFT background, with a minimum of 5 years of experience developing Python based microservices. The team is small and spread across Europe so you will need to be independent and be able to push projects through autonomously. Where a lot of HFT environments require you to be on-site almost every day, this one gives you flexibility of where you're based.




This a global high-frequency trading firm, specialising in crypto markets and leveraging cutting-edge technology to shape the future of trading on real-time. Starting salary is around $150k plus bonuses.




If you want your work to shape real-world trading decisions in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, get in touch.




No up to date CV required.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Remote - Europe or Asia)
Description:
Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

One of our partner companies is currently looking for a Senior Data Scientist - B2B based in Europe or Asia.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will join a distributed team focused on unlocking insights that power data-driven decisions for B2B initiatives. You'll work closely with other data scientists and engineers to explore user behavior, design impactful experiments, and develop strategic models that improve customer acquisition, retention, and product development. Your work will directly shape how professionals use digital tools at scale in a rapidly growing market segment. The team values autonomy, documentation, and async-first collaboration, with flexibility for remote work and timezone balance.

Accountabilities:


Analyze user behavior to uncover drivers of activation, engagement, churn, and upgrades
Lead experimentation efforts, including A/B test design and impact attribution
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to surface strategic insights and greenfield opportunities
Develop self-serve analytics tools, dashboards, and data literacy programs
Build and maintain predictive models and use case clustering solutions
Perform ETL tasks and model new data dimensions for strategic decision-making
Attribute product and marketing impact to core KPIs with statistical rigor



Requirements


6+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Python or R, and modern BI/analytics tools (e.g., dbt)
Expertise in statistical methods, experimentation design, and machine learning techniques
Proven experience analyzing large datasets to solve business problems
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain insights to non-technical audiences
Strong stakeholder management and ability to influence cross-functional teams
Passion for continuous learning, fast iteration, and working in a dynamic, async environment



Benefits


Meaningful equity in a profitable tech company
Flexible remote work with sponsored visits to regional offices (Hong Kong or London)
Annual company offsite (e.g., Portugal 2023, Bali 2024)
Comprehensive medical insurance for you and your dependents
Home office and wellness budget (equipment, training, etc.)
Flexible working hours and an async-first work culture



Jobgether hiring process disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🤖 The Job

At Dataroots, we couple our excellent consulting services with our technical expertise to build advanced machine learning models to improve business processes across a variety of industries, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our in-house team of AI specialists, designing and implementing models that deliver robust, data-driven solutions for our clients.




Passionate about data, you enjoy diving deep to uncover actionable insights and develop machine learning models that enhance client operations. You’ll experiment with different approaches, while collaborating with Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists to drive the delivery of tailored, high-quality, end-to-end solutions.




You’ll also have the opportunity to mentor colleagues, share knowledge, and stay on top of industry developments through a range of initiatives we support internally.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master’s or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
Strong foundation in software design principles.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in machine learning and big data.
Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
Proficiency in Python & SQL is a must; knowledge of R is an advantage.
Experience with deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
At least a first experience with AWS, Azure or GCP and a solid understanding of cloud engineering and its use in Machine Learning.
Experience with ML versioning tooling.
Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
Fluency in English and Dutch.




Don't worry if you don’t meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! 🎉

Show more

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].


💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

  • A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master’s or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
  • Strong foundation in software design principles.
  • A minimum of 2 years of experience in machine learning and big data.
  • Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
  • Proficiency in Python & SQL is a must; knowledge of R is an advantage.
  • Experience with deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
  • At least a first experience with AWS, Azure or GCP and a solid understanding of cloud engineering and its use in Machine Learning.
  • Experience with ML versioning tooling.
  • Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
  • Fluency in English and Dutch.


Don't worry if you don’t meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.


💰 The Offer

  • An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

  • Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
  • A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
  • Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.


📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.


🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! 🎉

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Are you a skilled ML Engineer ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in machine learning to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.

🔥 Your Responsibilities:



Design, build, and train machine learning models to address complex business problems.
Fine-tune model performance through feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and validation techniques.
Develop pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align model outcomes with strategic goals.
Stay up to date with emerging ML techniques and tools, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.



🎯 Your Profile:

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.



Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and model evaluation techniques.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Experience with cloud-based ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML).
Proven track record in deploying machine learning models at scale.



🚀 Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



💡 We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: ML Engineer – AI Team - Kantoor Antwerpen
Description:
Over Delen Private Bank

Delen Private Bank is een private vermogensbeheerder met een sterk uitgebouwd IT-team van 160 collega’s, binnen een organisatie van 600 medewerkers. We ontzorgen onze klanten met discretionair vermogensbeheer en -planning en zetten volop in op automatisatie via onze strategisch intern ontwikkelde Core Banking software.




Het AI team

Het AI Team binnen het data-domein van de IT-organisatie fungeert als brug tussen innovatieve AI-concepten en hun duurzame integratie in de operationele processen van de organisatie. Dit gebeurt vanuit onze visie om een vertrouwd, enterprise-grade AI platform op te zetten dat verantwoordelijke innovatie bij Delen stimuleert. Als centraal expertisecentrum werkt het team domeinoverschrijdend om proofs of concept uit het AI lab om te zetten in robuuste, schaalbare en verantwoorde AI-oplossingen in productie. Met een sterke focus op ethiek, verklaarbaarheid en technische integriteit, fungeert het team als center of excellence dat andere teams in staat stelt om AI-oplossingen op een verantwoorde manier en op schaal te leveren.

Het team bestaat momenteel uit een AI Product Owner, die de integratie aanstuurt van een herbruikbare suite van AI-capaciteiten in het IT-landschap, en is nu op zoek naar de eerste engineering-aanwinst om de technische fundamenten voor AI-adoptie in de organisatie uit te bouwen.




MLOps Engineer – Fundamentele Rol binnen het AI Team

Als onderdeel van het AI Team speelt de MLOps Engineer een fundamentele rol in het bouwen van de technische ruggengraat en operationele processen voor grootschalige AI-adoptie. Dit omvat het definiëren en implementeren van de MLOps architectuur die nodig is om machine learning-projecten in productie te brengen binnen de organisatie.

Deze rol is ideaal voor een ervaren platform- of MLOps engineer die eerder heeft bijgedragen aan het in productie brengen van ML-capaciteiten, bijvoorbeeld door interne ML-platformen te bouwen, modellen veilig en op schaal uit te rollen, of betrouwbare patronen te definiëren voor AI in productie.

De focus ligt op het versnellen van AI-innovatie binnen operationele processen, met behoud van kwaliteit, betrouwbaarheid en ethische integriteit van ML-oplossingen.

Opererend binnen het Data Domain, werkt de MLOps Engineer nauw samen met het DAR team, maar met een bredere scope: ondersteuning van meerdere domeinen, beheer van AI-oplossingen in productie, en begeleiding bij implementaties in samenwerking met andere teams.




Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

Definieer en implementeer het fundamentele MLOps framework voor modelontwikkeling, implementatie en monitoring binnen het IT-landschap.
Bouw en onderhoud de kerninfrastructuur en gedeelde capaciteiten die veilige en schaalbare AI-adoptie binnen de organisatie ondersteunen.
Bied duidelijke architecturale en operationele richtlijnen om andere teams in staat te stellen AI-oplossingen op een verantwoorde manier te bouwen en te beheren.
Evalueer en integreer MLOps tooling, met focus op Azure-native en Databricks-compatible oplossingen.
Stel standaarden, patronen en documentatie op om consistentie, betrouwbaarheid en onderhoudbaarheid in ML-ontwikkeling te garanderen.
Werk nauw samen met data engineers, architects en infrastructure teams om een vlotte integratie van AI-capaciteiten in productieomgevingen te verzekeren.
Bevorder observability, CI/CD discipline en lifecycle management in de context van AI-workloads.
Draag bij aan verantwoorde AI-adoptie door compliance, transparantie en beveiliging te verankeren in gedeelde tools en processen.
Zet mechanismen op om model performance en drift te monitoren, om zo de langdurige kwaliteit en het vertrouwen in productie-AI-systemen te waarborgen.




Wat jij meebrengt

Must-have

Ervaring met de volledige machine learning development lifecycle, en met het toepassen van DevOps principles (zoals CI/CD, testen, monitoring) op ML- of data-gedreven systemen.
Vaardig in Microsoft Azure en Databricks omgevingen, inclusief ervaring met het uitrollen en beheren van productie-workloads in de cloud.
Sterk begrip van containerization (Docker) en orchestration (Kubernetes) in een enterprise-context.
Aangetoonde ervaring in het bouwen en onderhouden van gedeelde infrastructuur of platformen die door andere teams worden gebruikt.
Werkkennis van Generative AI technologieën, waaronder prompt engineering, fine-tuning strategies, embeddings, en Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Vertrouwd met vector databases en hun integratie in productie-AI-systemen.




Mindset

Sterke samenwerkingsvaardigheden en het vermogen om anderen te begeleiden en ondersteunen bij het adopteren van gedeelde frameworks en standaarden.
Een pragmatische, platform-first benadering gericht op langdurige onderhoudbaarheid, veiligheid en compliance.
Een sterk gevoel van ownership en verantwoordelijkheid in het bouwen van betrouwbare en herbruikbare capaciteiten.




Wat bieden wij?

Aantrekkelijke voorwaarden: Je ontvangt een competitief salaris aangevuld met een uitgebreid pakket extralegale voordelen, zoals hospitalisatie- en tandzorgverzekering, groepsverzekering, ecocheques, gsm met abonnement, optieplan, extra verlofdagen (bank holidays), Benefits at Work, restaurant met versbereide maaltijden, keuze uit bedrijfswagen of andere (mobiliteits)oplossingen via het mobiliteitsbudget.
Ontwikkelkansen & intrapreneurship: Jouw groei staat centraal. We luisteren naar je ambities en helpen je actief om stappen te zetten binnen onze organisatie. Via opleidingen, interne mobiliteit en intrapreneurship krijg je de ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan. Jij bent de architect van je loopbaan – wij zorgen voor de juiste ondersteuning.
Persoonlijke aanpak: Als familiebedrijf sinds 1936 geloven we in de kracht van een persoonlijke aanpak. Je werkt in een warme en betrokken omgeving waar je écht gezien wordt. Dankzij onze vlakke structuur zijn de lijnen kort en is de directie – inclusief de familie – bereikbaar en betrokken. Ideeën krijgen snel gehoor, beslissingen worden doortastend genomen.
Collegiale sfeer: Samenwerken zit in ons DNA. Je komt terecht in een hecht team waar collega’s elkaar ondersteunen, kennis delen en elkaar motiveren. We werken in een open en toegankelijke sfeer aan gedeelde doelen – met succes én met ruimte voor humor. Even ontspannen? Neem een drankje en laad je op met een potje pingpong, pool, kickeren of XBox in onze ontspanningsruimte samen met je collega's.
Duurzame samenwerking: We bouwen aan relaties voor de lange termijn – met onze klanten én onze medewerkers. Ons zeer laag personeelsverloop is daar het bewijs van. Dankzij een cultuur van vertrouwen, open communicatie en stabiliteit krijg je de kans om samen met ons te groeien.
Data roadmap 2025 vormgeven: De kans om impact te maken met data in een organisatie die data als strategisch speerpunt ziet.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Description:
About

A fast-growing startup is developing a generative AI platform to accelerate protein design. You'll build and deploy ML models that turn scientific innovation into real-world biotech solutions.

Responsibilities


Lead research on generative models for protein design
Build and refine deep learning models using sequence, structure, and assay data
Work closely with wet-lab and bioengineering teams to align models with design goals
Translate research into production-ready systems
Uphold high standards in scientific rigor, code quality, and reproducibility


Requirements:


PhD or equivalent in ML, Computational Biology, or related field
Experience with deep learning models (e.g. transformers, VAEs, diffusion)
Strong understanding of biological data (proteins, structures, assays)
Track record of publications, open-source work, or deployed systems
Excellent collaboration and communication skills


NOTE: VISA SPONSORSHIP IS NOT PROVIDED.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced AI Engineer with a Data Science background to join our professional services team of 50+ engineers. The position is available full-time, with part-time arrangements possible for the right candidate. This remote-first role focuses on Generative AI development, specifically building and deploying advanced Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI agents. You'll work with state-of-the-art foundation models through platforms like AWS Bedrock and GCP Vertex AI to develop innovative GenAI applications and scalable AI infrastructure for our clients.




Key Responsibilities:

Generative AI Development:

Design and implement production-ready generative AI applications and AI agents using foundation models and cutting-edge protocols like MCP and A2A
Fine-tune and optimize LLMs for specific use cases and domains
Create and maintain prompt engineering strategies and evaluation frameworks
Design and deploy autonomous AI agents with targeted capabilities




AI/ML Engineering:

Build end-to-end LLM pipelines for fine-tuning, deployment, and monitoring
Implement RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems
Create efficient vector storage and embedding solutions




Infrastructure and Operations:

Build and maintain robust AI infrastructure using AWS and GCP services
Implement monitoring systems for model performance and infrastructure health
Optimize cloud resources for cost-efficiency while maintaining performance




Preferred Qualifications:

4+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or data science, with a recent focus on Generative AI
Strong programming skills and experience with LLM and Agent frameworks (LangChain, CrewAI)
Expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and containerization technologies
Deep understanding of LLM operations, including prompt engineering and RAG
Experience with vector databases and semantic search implementations
Experience building and deploying AI agents using modern frameworks
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities




Employment Options:

Full-time position (40 hours/week)
Part-time arrangements available for qualified candidates (minimum 20 hours/week)




Benefits:

Potential career paths include AI Team Lead
Collaborative remote team environment
Opportunity to contribute to open-source GenAI initiatives and research publications

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Senior AI Engineer – Python · GCP · LLMs/NLP




An early-stage startup is looking for a Senior AI Engineer to guide a small, cross-functional team (4) in delivering impactful solutions through fast, iterative development cycles.

The team is building a platform that leverages large language models (LLMs) to convert literature into structured knowledge, helping accelerate discovery




Key Responsibilities

Drive the technical vision and ensure consistent, high-quality delivery.
Define and evolve the architecture for data ingestion, processing, and user interface layers.
Design, develop, and deploy LLM/NLP pipelines.
Build using Python, GCP, TypeScript, and a mix of open-source and commercial LLMs (e.g., Hugging Face).
Offer hands-on support to engineers and help remove technical blockers.
Collaborate closely with domain experts to solve real-world scientific challenges.
Focus on execution and outcomes, rather than people management.




Requirements

Strong experience with Python and cloud platforms (GCP preferred).
Practical knowledge of LLMs or machine learning,
Clear communication skills and a strong sense of ownership.
Proficiency in English (spoken and written).
Plus if you have experience with Bio Tech or Drug discovery




Nice to Have

Experience with open source or freemium product development.

We’re looking for a motivated Data Scientist intern for a 3-month internship!

You will help us explore large datasets and connect advanced AI models with diverse data sources to generate actionable insights. Your work will directly contribute to the development of innovative, data-driven features that leverage cutting-edge machine learning and natural language processing techniques.

Your primary focus will be on applying data analytics methods, performing statistical analysis, and building intelligent algorithms together with our team. You will work on projects that bridge data science and product innovation, helping our platform deliver smarter recommendations and enhanced value to our customers.

You will be directly mentored by an experienced data scientist, while working closely with the full team and reporting weekly to the CTO, CPO, and CEO of the company.

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
About HireShire




HireShire is a modern staffing and talent acquisition platform helping leading organizations find exceptional talent. We’re now expanding into the Data & Analytics vertical and are looking for curious, driven, and analytical minds to join us as part of our Data Science Internship Cohort.




Role Overview




As a Data Science Intern at HireShire, you will collaborate with our engineering and strategy teams to design data-driven solutions that power smarter hiring, workforce planning, and operational decision-making. This is a hands-on role where you’ll work on real business datasets to build production-ready analytics models and dashboards.




Key Responsibilities




Collect, clean, analyze, and transform structured & semi-structured HR and recruitment datasets
Build predictive models for talent forecasting, attrition risk, and candidate success scores
Develop data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Python, SQL & BI tools
Perform EDA (exploratory data analysis) to uncover insights that inform recruitment strategies
Work with time-series & cohort data for trend analysis and performance metrics
Deploy statistical and ML algorithms (regression, clustering, classification) in scalable pipelines
Communicate findings & recommendations with clear visual and written formats to stakeholders




Requirements




Pursuing (or recently completed) B.Tech/BE/M.Tech/MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields
Proficiency in Python + core libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib/Seaborn, Scikit-learn)
Familiarity with SQL for querying relational datasets
Sound understanding of ML fundamentals – supervised/unsupervised learning methods
Strong statistics foundation – distributions, hypothesis testing, probability
Ability to interpret data, derive insights, and present conclusions clearly
Strong communication skills, ownership mindset & enthusiasm to learn




Nice to Have (Bonus)




Knowledge of BI tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / Metabase)
Basics of cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) or Docker
Prior exposure to HR analytics or recruitment datasets




What You’ll Get




Practical exposure to solving real-world data problems in HR Tech
Experience working on high-impact product features used by recruiters and hiring managers
1:1 mentorship by experienced data scientists and access to premium resources
Internship Certificate & Letter of Recommendation upon successful completion
Opportunity for a Pre-Placement Offer (PPO) at HireShire or client companies




Hiring Process




Online Application

Submit CV, GitHub/Kaggle links, and a brief note on your interest and experience

Technical Assessment

Assignment to test Python, SQL, EDA, or modeling approach

Technical Interview

In-depth discussion (45 mins) on your ML/stats understanding & problem-solving

Managerial Interview

Evaluate communication skills, culture fit & motivation

Offer

Selected applicants receive the internship offer with stipend details & project allocation

Onboarding

Orientation, project assignment & setup with tools and mentors




Stipend

Minimum stipend starts at 18 euro/hour, with the possibility of a higher rate based on performance in the interviews.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Crossing Hurdles is a recruitment firm. We refer top candidates to our partners working with the world’s leading AI research labs to help build and train cutting-edge AI models.




Position: Machine Learning Engineer – AI Model Benchmarking

Type: Hourly Contract

Compensation: Up to $140/hour

Location: Remote

Duration: 4–6 weeks




Role Responsibilities

Draft detailed, executable natural-language plans to address machine learning–related Kaggle competition tasks.
Implement these plans in Python within a provided Docker environment.
Validate implementations against the original plans and identify discrepancies.
Apply reproducibility and benchmarking best practices to evaluate AI model development pipelines.
Work independently while adhering to compliance and quality standards.




Requirements

Strong professional experience in applied machine learning or MLE roles.
Strong Python skills for model training, data processing, and automation.
Experience with Docker-based development workflows.
Proven ability to design and implement reproducible ML experiments.
Detail-oriented, analytical approach to problem-solving.




P.S. – Accept the referral invite that will pop up during the application process so we can keep you posted and help you with any issues or questions.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At The Stepstone Group, we have a simple yet very important mission: The right job for everyone. Using our data, platform, and technology, we create opportunities for jobseekers and companies around the world to find a perfect match in fair and equitable way. With over 20 brands across 30+ countries, we strive for fair and unbiased hiring. Join our team of 4,000+ employees and be part of reshaping the labour market and becoming the world's leading job platform. Join our team and you'll be responsible for our recommender systems and search algorithms, building the core infrastructure that powers millions of meaningful connections. Working in the Search & Match domain, you will be focusing on deploying and scaling machine learning models, particularly large language models (LLMs). You will collaborate with data scientists to make sure our models are efficient and can be properly optimized for cost and performance. You will work with software engineers to set up modern machine learning pipelines ensuring high operational standards. If you'd like to make a difference by maintaining cutting-edge, scalable machine learning infrastructure that brings the right people to the right jobs, then we'd love to hear from you! You will play a vital role as we reimagine the labour market to make it work for everybody. Your responsibilities: Collaborate with data scientists, ML Engineers, and backend engineers within an Agile environment Deploy and scale ML models, particularly large language models (LLMs) Build and maintain scalable pipelines and services to support real-time ML applications Maintain and improve recommender systems Build and work with modern API and microservices architectures Strong foundation in Python Experience with machine learning, familiar with Huggingface, Pytorch, and similar ML tools and packages Familiarity with deploying and scaling ML models in the cloud, particularly with AWS and SageMaker Understanding of DevOps processes and tools: CI/CD, Docker, Terraform, and monitoring/observability Bonus: experience with vector databases, semantic search, or event-driven systems like Kafka We're a community here that cares as much about your life outside work as how you feel when you're with us. Because your job shouldn't take over your life, it should enrich it. Here are some of the benefits we offer: 29 Vacation Days (20 + 9 recovery days as we work 39h/week instead of 38) Hybrid Working Model Group Insurance (Life, Pension & Disability) Hospital Insurance Lunch Vouchers Eco Cheques Flexible Compensation Plan Ongoing Development 2 Volunteering Days Fitness Classes and Studio 24/7 Employee Assistance Program Free Parking and public transport ticket (Company cars and fuel card for Key Account Managers and Managers) Drinks and snacks Access to corporate benefits app Home Office Allowance Our commitment Equal opportunities are important to us. We believe that diversity and inclusion at The Stepstone Group are critical... Title: Innovation Officer (H/F/X) NL
Description:
Met bijna 4.000 medewerkers en een uitgebreid onderwijsnetwerk behoort de Stad Brussel tot de grootste werkgevers van het Brussels Gewest. Vastberaden om zich op de toekomst te richten, streeft zij er niet alleen naar een slimme en duurzame stad te worden, maar ook een proactieve rol op te nemen tegenover de grote uitdagingen van onze tijd.

In dit kader speelt de Directie Strategie en Digitale Transformatie een centrale rol. Zij stuurt de uitwerking en de opvolging van de algemene strategie van de Stad, coördineert de structurele projecten en leidt de programma’s voor digitale transformatie met het oog op de opbouw van een slimme stad die steunt op datagebruik.

Om deze ambitie te versterken, heeft de Stad beslist haar Dienst Strategie uit te rusten met een innovatieteam. Gedurende de komende drie jaar zal dit team de opdracht hebben zich te richten op twee complexe, transversale en prioritaire uitdagingen voor Brussel. Het zal worden aangemoedigd om nieuwe werkmethodes en benaderingen van publieke innovatie uit te testen.

Dit initiatief beoogt een dubbele doelstelling: de levenskwaliteit van de Brusselaars concreet verbeteren én innovatieve praktijken, eenmaal bewezen, duurzaam te verankeren binnen de administratie, om zo haar modernisering en aanpassingsvermogen te ondersteunen.

This position is part of City of Brussels participation in the Bloomberg Philanthropies Innovation team (i-team) program. Charged with helping city officials and civic partners design and implement solutions that meet pressing local challenges, the i-team will expertly deploy data, collect insight, and collaborate across sectors—crowding the energy and resources across City of Brussels—to develop resident-centered interventions that improve people’s lives. The i-team will receive technical assistance from regional and global specialists, and benefit from learnings from peers in city halls across the region and around the world. To date, the Bloomberg Philanthropies i-team initiative has reached over 100 cities across 16 countries and four continents—representing more than 100 million residents—and inspired hundreds of other local governments to embrace innovation systems and practices.







Functie

Je leidt en stimuleert het werk van het innovatieteam rond twee stedelijke uitdagingen

:Chrono-urbanisme (10-minutenstad): concentratie van voorzieningen in multifunctionele wijkclusters en beter gebruik van bestaande infrastructuur
.Leegstaande/verlaten woningen: aanpak van obstakels rond kleine wooneenheden (eengezinswoningen, kleine appartementen, woningen boven winkels)

.Je zorgt voor strategisch en operationeel leiderschap, coördineert de samenwerking tussen diensten en partners en garandeert dat de acties tastbare resultaten opleveren voor de inwoners. Je bent ook het aanspreekpunt voor de Europese i-teams en Bloomberg Philanthropies, en draagt bij aan een cultuurverandering die innovatie structureel in de werking van de Stad verankert.

Taken

Uitdagingen aanpakken

Coördineren van de uitvoering van de projecten en afstemmen op de strategische ambities
Mobiliseren van interne en externe stakeholders
Waken over doelstellingen, budget en deadlines; superviseren van deliverables

Leiderschap & strategie

Samen met de collega van het i-team de innovatiestrategie mee bepalen
Een cultuur van experimenteren en samenwerking installeren
Structurele hefbomen identificeren om innovatie duurzaam te verankeren

Institutioneel & partnerschappen

De Stad vertegenwoordigen in het Europese i-teams-netwerk en bij Bloomberg
Strategische communicatie verzekeren met Burgemeester en topmanagement
Rapporten opstellen (Engels) en het administratieve en financiële beheer opvolgen

Methodologie & betrokkenheid

Ontwerpen en begeleiden van workshops, co-creatie en collectieve intelligentie
Projectlessen vertalen naar beleid, processen en tools
Studies, analyses en aanbestedingen initiëren of opvolgen

Profiel

Competenties

Ruime ervaring in beheer van complexe, transversale projecten, idealiter in een publieke context
Aantoonbaar leiderschap, capaciteit om multidisciplinaire teams te inspireren
Ervaring met publieke innovatie, organisatieverandering of beleidsdesign
Inzicht in stedelijke dynamieken en interesse in duurzaamheid en burgerparticipatie

Kwaliteiten

Sterk analytisch en synthetisch vermogen, resultaatgericht
Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden (NL/FR/EN)
Politiek inzicht, diplomatie en wendbaarheid in een meerpartijenomgeving
Systemische visie, creatieve en innovatieve ingesteldheid

Troeven

Grondige kennis van de Brusselse administratie
Ervaring met internationale programma’s, subsidies of innovatienetwerken
Kennis chrono-urbanisme, burgerparticipatie of stedelijke innovatie
Certificaat projectmanagement (PMP, Prince2, Agile)




Vereist diploma

Je bent houder van een Masterdiploma

Of je voldoet aan de voorwaarden voor interne mobiliteit voor een functie van niveau A of voor promotie naar een functie in de graad van bestuurssecretaris

.Indien je je diploma behaald hebt in het buitenland, is op enkele uitzonderingen na, een gelijkwaardigheidserkenning door NARIC-Vlaanderen nodig (https://www.vlaanderen.be/gelijkwaardigheidserkenning-van-een-buitenlands-diploma-of-getuigschrift-in-vlaanderen)

Aanbod




Een voltijds contract dat verbonden is aan de looptijd van de subsidies (1/11/2025 tot en met 31/10/20
27)Bruto maandelijks salaris: minimum 3.913,31 euro's (dat kan hoger zijn afhankelijk van de waardering van eerdere werkervaringen, familiale situatie en het slagen voor de taalexamens). Je kunt een schatting van jouw salaris krijgen via via onze online loonsimulator
Een tweetaligheidspremie (onder voorbehoud van het behalen van het onderzoek van Selor artikel 8 en artikel 9§2)
Eindejaarspremie en vakantieg
Maaltijdcheques (8 euro’s, waarvan 6,91 euro’s ten laste van de Stad Brussel)
Geniet van 36,5 dagen betaald verlof, 4 dagen vastgesteld verlof door de Stad en 10 wettelijke feestdagen
Mogelijkheid tot een voordelige hospitalisatieverzekering en dekking van het remgeld door de Stad voor medische zorg, voor u en uw gezin in het UZ Brugmann, UMC Sint-Pieter, Institut Jules Bordet en Koningin Fabiola Kinderziekenhuis
Pensioenplan voor contractuele medewerkers ter waarde van 3% van het bruto salaris
De meeste van onze administratieve functies zijn hybride met de mogelijkheid tot telewerken na 6 maanden, gekoppeld aan een forfaitaire tussenkomst van 20 euro per maand.
De Stad Brussel voldoet aan jouw behoeften op het gebied van professionele ontwikkeling door regelmatige trainingen aan te bieden (aan te passen indien nodig).
Onze werkplekken zijn gemakkelijk bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer en het MIVB-abonnement wordt 100% terugbetaald, er is ook een tussenkomst in de vervoerskosten (NMBS, De Lijn, TEC, fiets).




SELECTIEPROCEDURES

Stuur ons je kandidatuur uiterlijk tegen 21/09/2025 (curriculum vitae + motivatiebrief + kopie van het vereiste diploma). Onvolledige kandidaturen (zonder alle vereiste documenten) worden niet in aanmerking genomen. Een eerste selectie gebeurt op basis van het cv en de motivatiebrief. Kandidaten die overeenkomen met het profiel worden telefonisch uitgenodigd voor geautomatiseerde selectietests en voor twee selectiegesprekken. Deze zullen plaatsvinden voor een selectiecommissie en zullen betrekking hebben op motivatie, gedragscompetenties en technische competenties. Demos Helsinki (onafhankelijke denktank) zal deelnemen aan deze gesprekken. Door te solliciteren aanvaard je dat je persoonsgegevens uitsluitend en strikt in het kader van deze selectieprocedure met hun consultants worden gedeeld.

De Stad Brussel selecteert kandidaten op basis van hun competenties en maakt geen onderscheid naar leeftijd, geslacht, etnische afkomst, overtuiging, handicap of nationaliteit. We moedigen personen met een handicap aan om te solliciteren. We houden rekening met eventuele noodzakelijke aanpassingen, zowel in de selectieprocedure als bij de integratie binnen de administratie.

Show more

Title: Head of Artificial Intelligence
Description:
The Role




My client is seeking a Head of AI to lead the design, development, and evolution of their next-generation AI platform. This platform will serve as the foundation for training and deploying advanced AI systems, with a strong focus on multi-agent architectures and large-scale intelligence.




As Head of AI, you will shape the strategy, guide technical execution, and lead a high-performing team of AI engineers, platform specialists, and MLOps experts.




Your mission is to ensure we deliver a robust, scalable, and future-proof environment for AI research and production, driving innovation while ensuring operational excellence. This role is offered on a 12-month contract basis with a likelihood to go to perm after that.




Key Responsibilities

Set the Vision: Define and own the strategy for AI infrastructure, ensuring alignment with company goals and cutting-edge AI research.
Lead and Inspire: Build, mentor, and empower a multidisciplinary team of software engineers, AI engineers, and MLOps specialists.
Platform Ownership: Architect, develop, and maintain a scalable AI platform with best practices in automation, MLOps, security, and infrastructure-as-code.
End-to-End AI Lifecycle: Oversee data pipelines, experiment tracking, distributed training, deployment, monitoring, and scaling of advanced AI systems.
Tooling and Ecosystem: Select and manage the right AI/MLOps tools (Kubeflow, MLflow, Argo, CI/CD, artifact management, monitoring systems) in collaboration with DevOps.
Resource Optimization: Ensure efficient use of compute, storage, and networking resources to support large-scale AI workloads cost-effectively.
Collaboration: Partner closely with internal research teams and external collaborators to streamline AI development workflows and accelerate innovation.
Governance and Safety: Define and enforce best practices for data governance, platform security, and operational excellence in alignment with AI safety principles.
Thought Leadership: Stay ahead of the curve in AI infrastructure, MLOps, LLMOps, and cloud-native technologies, bringing insights into platform evolution.
Optional External Role: Represent the company at conferences, industry forums, and open-source communities as a leader in AI infrastructure.







Qualifications

Advanced degree (BSc, MSc, or PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
7+ years of experience building AI/ML platforms, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
Proven success in leading AI or platform engineering teams and delivering production-grade systems.
Strong expertise in Kubernetes, cloud-native infrastructure, and distributed systems.
Hands-on experience with MLOps pipelines and large-scale ML training and deployment.
Skilled in programming (Python, Go, or similar) and infrastructure-as-code (Terraform or equivalent).
Familiarity with ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX) and system requirements for large models.
Background in AI infrastructure for complex workloads such as multi-agent systems, reinforcement learning, or large-scale distributed training is a strong advantage.
Deep knowledge of cloud and on-prem hybrid environments, including networking, storage, and security.
Experience with at least one major cloud platform (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Fluent in English, other European languages are a plus.
