Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

This Data Science position is embedded within the Analytics Team, which plays a pivotal role in developing tools and analyses that drive the day-to-day operations of Vitol. The successful candidate will leverage data science and machine learning to revolutionize how Vitol tracks and anticipates commodity movements across the globe.

While regular collaboration with the central Data Science team is expected, this role is uniquely positioned within the team of developers and analysts focused on vessel and cargo flows. This setup fosters knowledge exchange, process improvements, and regular interaction with various business units that depend on these analyses.

The ideal candidate will have a hands-on approach, ready to dive deep into data, build models, create visualizations, and deliver actionable insights as needed. They will thrive in a fast-paced environment and be motivated by seeing their work have an immediate impact on Vitol’s operations.

Key Responsabilities :


Be an energetic and enthusiastic team member, uniquely positioned to harness the power of data to transform the inner workings of the commodities industry
Gain a deep understanding of Vitol’s core operations and develop creative solutions using data, automation, analytics, models, and optimization to enhance these operations
Explore new datasets and external vendor predictions/algorithms, extract meaningful insights, and present results through visualizations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Work closely with domain experts to design and implement machine learning solutions that are both understandable and usable by non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate with the central Data Science team and IT department to leverage existing tools and capabilities to deliver value to the business


Qualifications


Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent experience
Strong foundation in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning or equivalent experience
Extensive experience in exploring and extracting insights from heterogeneous multi-dimensional datasets is essential
Proficiency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code in a collaborative development environment
Experience in visualizing complex data for diverse audiences using tools such as D3.js, Bokeh, Plotly or similar frameworks
5-7 years of industry experience as a data scientist on real-world datasets, is preferred
C# development experience is a plus
French language skills are an advantage but not required


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


Proven experience in working within an Agile Scrum development model
Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team
Proactive and user-focused approach, embodying a "make it work" mentality, with a genuine interest in both the functional and technical aspects of challenges encountered
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration across diverse teams
Fluent in English, with full proficiency in business communication, both verbal and written
Passionate about leveraging data science and machine learning to innovate and disrupt traditionally human-centric industries
Skilled in deriving, abstracting, and translating value from complex models into actionable insights within a commercial context
Resourceful, creative, and adaptable, thriving in fast-paced, results-driven environments


What We Offer


Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Our Geneva office is located very centrally, 5 minutes from the main train station and 1 minute from the lake. The office has a rooftop lunch area, with views over the lake and Alps.
We organize regular activities to enable our people to meet colleagues from other teams in an informal setting, and to celebrate special achievements

Title: Head of AI & Data Science
Description:
Company Overview

Imagine leveraging your expertise in AI and data science to directly improve the lives of millions of people living with hypertension. Hilo by Aktiia, is revolutionizing how cardiovascular health is monitored and managed. They've developed and commercialized the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor, empowering both patients and physicians with unprecedented insights into blood pressure patterns. Backed by over $100M in funding from top-tier investors across Europe and the US, Hilo is an early-stage, fast-growing startup rooted in over 20 years of research at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Their CE-certified, Class IIa medical device is already available in over 10 countries worldwide—and they're just getting started.

As Aktiia enters a new growth phase, we're looking for a capable and visionary "Head of AI & Data Science" to scale their capabilities and lead a team that sits at the heart of the product innovation.

HEAD OF AI & DATA SCIENCE

Role & Responsibilities


Team & Project Leadership


Own planning, prioritization, and execution of AI & Data Science initiatives. Align roadmaps with product requirements and drive timely delivery with your team.


Cross-functional Collaboration


Act as the operational bridge between AI, Product, Marketing, Customer Support teams and the CTO. Solve blockers and ensure smooth collaboration.


People Development


Lead and grow a diverse team through coaching, recruitment, performance reviews, and day-to-day guidance - with a balance of empathy and results-orientation.


External Engagement


Interface with medical professionals, customers, and strategic partners. Incorporate feedback and deliver concepts, documentation, and visual materials.


Process Optimization


Define and implement workflows and structures that support scalable, efficient team operations.

Your profile


Academic Background


PhD in Informatics, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Data Science, Signal Processing or a related field.


Technical Expertise


5+ years of hands-on engineering experience in data science and ML/AI. Strong Python skills and familiarity with ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn). Solid understanding of CNNs, RNNs and time series analysis. Medtech and signal processing knowledge (PPG, ECG) are a plus.


Leadership Experience


Several years experience of people management, ideally with responsibility for 10+ team members. Experience in fast-paced environments and team transformation.


Industry Fit


Background in regulated industries (e.g. medtech, pharma, fintech, aerospace). Experience in startups or mid-sized companies preferred.


Language Skills


English at highly proficient level is a must. French, German or Italian are advantageous.


Personality


Energetic, intellectually curious, hands-on and collaborative. A natural team leader who inspires others and leads with clarity and positivity.

Do you want to build something that changes lives while advancing science and technology? Then we're excited to meet you!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Spacewise is an innovative B2B SaaS proptech company headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, with a rapidly expanding presence. Spacewise is revolutionizing the way commercial real estate landlords market, manage, and monetize their portfolios and spaces online to supercharge the value of their consumer facing properties. Spacewise also operates the premier online marketplace for short-term, pop-up, and promotional spaces.




For landlords, we provide user-friendly software tools to digitize property and space inventory for seamless space marketing and management. Our platform is trusted by major organizations such as Regency Centers and Centennial in North America; and Migros, Coop, SBB, Swiss Post, and Wincasa in Europe, just to name a few. Furthermore, we enable lead generation and booking activities for many of the world’s most renowned brands. Tenants of all sizes use our platform to effortlessly search, evaluate, and book the perfect location for their marketing activations, events, pop-ups, and promotions.




Are you passionate about digital transformation and helping to shape the future of one of the biggest asset classes in the world? Do you like working in an innovative, fast-paced environment? If so, the role as Data Scientist at Spacewise could be the perfect opportunity for you.


Tasks



Develop predictive models and algorithms that analyze various data inputs, including location intelligence, foot traffic, and economic trends, to improve decision-making processes.


Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, and business) to integrate machine learning models and data insights into the product ecosystem.


Identify, collect, and analyze relevant data sources to deliver insights that enhance property pricing strategies, space utilization, and tenant matching.


Create and refine forecasting models to predict future trends and outcomes, such as foot traffic patterns, sales potential, and space demand.


Perform exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling to understand key business drivers and deliver actionable recommendations.


Build and maintain scalable data pipelines to enable real-time analytics and reporting.


Communicate complex analytical results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, contributing to the strategic direction of the company.



Requirements



Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.


Proven experience in building machine learning models and algorithms, preferably within the real estate, retail, or spatial analytics domains.Strong proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Python, R, SQL, Pandas, Matplotlib).


Experience working with large datasets and applying statistical techniques such as regression, clustering, and time-series analysis.Familiarity with location-based analytics and spatial data, including the use of geospatial data for forecasting and analysis.


Experience developing pricing algorithms or revenue management systems is a strong plus.Ability to communicate complex concepts clearly to both technical and business teams.


Familiarity with cloud-based platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure for data storage and analysis.


Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.





Preferred Qualifications:





Experience with recommendation systems or personalization algorithms.


Knowledge of optimization techniques for pricing and inventory management.


Familiarity with foot traffic data, sales potential forecasting, and revenue optimization strategies in commercial spaces.



Benefits



Competitive salary and benefits package.


Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative environment at the intersection of real estate and technology.


Remote-friendly workplace with flexible working hours.


Growth opportunities in a rapidly scaling company.





Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and why you're a good fit for this role.

HTML:
Spacewise is an innovative B2B SaaS proptech company headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, with a rapidly expanding presence. Spacewise is revolutionizing the way commercial real estate landlords market, manage, and monetize their portfolios and spaces online to supercharge the value of their consumer facing properties. Spacewise also operates the premier online marketplace for short-term, pop-up, and promotional spaces.


For landlords, we provide user-friendly software tools to digitize property and space inventory for seamless space marketing and management. Our platform is trusted by major organizations such as Regency Centers and Centennial in North America; and Migros, Coop, SBB, Swiss Post, and Wincasa in Europe, just to name a few. Furthermore, we enable lead generation and booking activities for many of the world’s most renowned brands. Tenants of all sizes use our platform to effortlessly search, evaluate, and book the perfect location for their marketing activations, events, pop-ups, and promotions.


Are you passionate about digital transformation and helping to shape the future of one of the biggest asset classes in the world? Do you like working in an innovative, fast-paced environment? If so, the role as Data Scientist at Spacewise could be the perfect opportunity for you.


Tasks

  • Develop predictive models and algorithms that analyze various data inputs, including location intelligence, foot traffic, and economic trends, to improve decision-making processes.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, and business) to integrate machine learning models and data insights into the product ecosystem.

  • Identify, collect, and analyze relevant data sources to deliver insights that enhance property pricing strategies, space utilization, and tenant matching.

  • Create and refine forecasting models to predict future trends and outcomes, such as foot traffic patterns, sales potential, and space demand.

  • Perform exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling to understand key business drivers and deliver actionable recommendations.

  • Build and maintain scalable data pipelines to enable real-time analytics and reporting.

  • Communicate complex analytical results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, contributing to the strategic direction of the company.


Requirements

  • Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.

  • Proven experience in building machine learning models and algorithms, preferably within the real estate, retail, or spatial analytics domains.Strong proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Python, R, SQL, Pandas, Matplotlib).

  • Experience working with large datasets and applying statistical techniques such as regression, clustering, and time-series analysis.Familiarity with location-based analytics and spatial data, including the use of geospatial data for forecasting and analysis.

  • Knowledge of optimization techniques for pricing and inventory management.

  • Familiarity with foot traffic data, sales potential forecasting, and revenue optimization strategies in commercial spaces.


Benefits

  • Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative environment at the intersection of real estate and technology.

  • Remote-friendly workplace with flexible working hours.

  • Growth opportunities in a rapidly scaling company.

Title: Data scientist/Data analyst
Description:
Location: Switzerland (Zurich / Geneva / Basel – hybrid/flexible)

Employment Type: Full-time / Permanent

Role Overview

We are seeking a Data Scientist / Data Analyst to join our Swiss analytics team. You will help turn complex data into actionable insights, supporting business decisions, predictive modeling, and data-driven strategies. This role is ideal for candidates with strong analytical, statistical, and programming skills who enjoy solving business problems through data.

Key Responsibilities
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to support business decisions.
Build dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product, finance, and operations.
Ensure data quality, governance, and compliance with Swiss and EU regulations.
Support ad hoc analyses and business intelligence projects.
Requirements
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.
1–5 years of experience in data analysis, data science, or business intelligence.
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, or similar programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Fluency in English; German or French is a plus.
Salary Reference (Switzerland, 2025)

LevelMonthly CHFAnnual CHFEntry-Level Analyst5,500 – 7,00066,000 – 84,000Mid-Level Data Scientist7,000 – 10,00084,000 – 120,000Senior Data Scientist / Analyst10,000 – 14,000120,000 – 168,000Lead / Principal14,000 – 18,000+168,000 – 216,000+

(Salaries vary depending on city, company size, and experience; Zurich and Geneva usually at the higher end.)

What We Offer
Competitive Swiss market salary with potential bonuses.
Exposure to data-driven projects across multiple business areas.
Professional development and training opportunities in data science and analytics.
Collaborative, innovative, and international work environment.
How to Apply

Send your CV and cover letter to [email address], or apply via LinkedIn with the subject line:

“Application for Data Scientist / Data Analyst – Switzerland.”

📌 #Hiring #DataScience #Analytics #SwitzerlandCareers

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Building the bank of tomorrow takes more than skills.

It means combining our differences to imagine, discuss, code, develop, test, learn… and celebrate every step together. Share our vibes? Join Swissquote to unleash your potential.

We are the Swiss Leader in Online Banking and we provide trading, investing and banking services to +500’000 clients, through our performant and secured digital platforms.

Our +1000 employees work in a flexible way, without dress code and in multicultural teams.

By having a huge impact on the industry, they are growing their skills portfolio and boosting their career in a fast-pace environment

We are all in at Swissquote. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome candidates from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives to join our team and contribute to our shared success.

Are you all in? Don’t be shy, apply!

Job Description

Swissquote is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our rapidly expanding Quantitative Research & Solutions department. This is an exciting opportunity for recent graduates with relevant internship experience in data science, machine learning or related fields, who are eager to launch their career in a fast-paced and innovative environment.

Responsibilities


Develop machine learning models.
Design and develop data pipelines.
Perform statistical data analysis.
Develop and experiment with generative AI models, including leveraging proprietary APIs and fine-tuning pre-trained models for custom applications.
Rapidly prototype models and conduct experiments to validate hypotheses and improve model performance.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Communicate complex findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, supporting data-driven decision-making.


Qualifications


Educational Background: Master’s degree in Data Science, Physics, Mathematics, Computer science or a related quantitative field.
Experience: One or more relevant internships in data science, machine learning, or AI-related fields.


Skills

Technical Skills:


Solid programming skills in Python, including experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy).
Hands-on experience developing machine learning models, either in academic projects or through internships, using libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Familiar with version control tools
Good understanding of statistical analysis techniques, including hypothesis testing, anomaly detection, and data modeling.
Proficient in creating data visualizations using tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, or dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Basic understanding of LLM architectures (e.g., Transformer-based models) and experience experimenting with LLM APIs (such as OpenAI or Hugging Face) is a strong plus.


Soft Skills


Eagerness to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.
Good communication skills and team spirit.
Analytical and problem-solving mindset.
Ability to take initiative and manage time effectively.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
THIS JOB IS NOT A REMOTE JOB. WORK ONSITE IS OBLIGATORY.




Snapbau is a digital purchasing management platform used by more than 320 construction companies in Switzerland, including major players such as Orllati, CPSA, Scrasa and ARSA. Our solution automates and optimises the management of calls for tender and purchasing, enabling companies to save time, reduce errors and centralise collaboration with suppliers.




You will be part of the team responsible for designing and building the AI layer of Snapbau’s digital operating system for procurement and coordination in the construction sector.


Tasks


AI System Design & Development





Develop machine learning and AI models to automate and optimize construction procurement workflows (e.g. price prediction, document classification, lead scoring, supplier matching).


Build generative AI features to assist with document generation, meeting summaries, and structured communication.


Create and maintain pipelines for training, testing, and deploying ML models.


Develop lightweight APIs or services to integrate AI modules into the Snapbau platform.





Data Engineering & Management





Work closely with backend developers to structure, clean, and extract usable data from various sources (e.g. supplier databases, project histories, tender documents).


Apply construction-specific taxonomies (e.g. eBKP-H, CRB) to enable structured, domain-relevant decision-making.


Improve model performance through effective feature engineering based on our domain data.





Product Integration





Collaborate with product managers and frontend developers to design and implement AI-powered tools for end users.


Ensure AI components are integrated into Snapbau’s user experience in a fast, reliable, and intuitive way.


Monitor model performance post-deployment and adjust based on feedback and new data.





Strategy & Innovation





Contribute to Snapbau’s long-term AI architecture and roadmap.


Stay updated on advancements in applied AI (LLMs, computer vision, agent workflows, etc.) and evaluate their relevance for construction tech.


Help define AI-related hiring, tooling, and infrastructure needs as the team scales.



Requirements



Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models (especially NLP, classification, recommendation, or price prediction).


Strong programming skills in Python; familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, FastAPI.


Experience building and maintaining ML pipelines.


Familiarity with REST APIs and integrating ML models into production environments.


Solid understanding of data wrangling and structuring from messy or unstructured sources.


Knowledge of or willingness to learn domain-specific standards such as eBKP-H or CRB is a strong plus.


Experience working in fast-paced, cross-functional product teams.


Ability to work autonomously while contributing to a strategic, long-term vision.





Join Snapbau if you want to shape how AI transforms the future of construction procurement. This role offers high impact, deep technical ownership, and a direct path into one of the most overlooked but critical sectors of the real economy.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.




We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.




Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




We use a modern stack of:





PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS


Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks


As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.




Particularly, you will get to:





Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.


Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.


All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.


Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.





In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements


Ideally, you have:





MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.


Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.


Experience with building and shipping software solutions.


Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits


We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




Interested? Contact us!




We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Optimization Data Scientist
Description:
Contexte et environnement

Your mission

As part of the Optimization Services team, you will design, develop, deploy and support the Data Science models of the team’s systems/applications.

The Optimization Services team focuses on the multi-market multi-asset optimizations of short-term power trading. We are part of the Gas & Power IT department for the Trading business lines of the TotalEnergies company, whose main office is in Geneva with a presence on other continents (Singapore, Houston, Dubaï, etc.).

TotalEnergies Gas & Power Trading (TGP) and its affiliates has a large and complex systems environment, which is evolving with the expansion of the power trading business and its impact on trading IT. To accompany these evolutions, the Optimization Services team participates in a significant change program that will have notable impacts both on the short-term and the long-term. In this context, the team is leveraging Data Science and Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP.

This role is global and focuses on the tools used by the front office and the integration into the overall energy management systems. The continuation of the systems performance, availability, and resilience, as well as scalability, need to be assured.

Activités

What You Will Do

Your focus will be on the Data Science models of the Optimization Service’s team applications. A significant part of these models will be based on Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP. You will interact mainly with the team’s Business Analysts, Data Scientists and Back-end Developers.

Analyze:


Understand the business context and specifications
Analyze the technical and functional feasibility
Participate in the design authority processes



Produce:


Design, develop and deploy new functionalities according to business needs
Ensure the proper functioning of the deliverable through monitoring and testing
Ensure the models are seamlessly integrated in the related applications
Implement the adequate balance between model precision and computation complexity
Adjust the deliverables based on feedback
Ensure adherence to best practice, guidelines and procedures for development, test and deployment
Maintain compliance of development and related activities with audit, cybersecurity and other internal requirements



Run & Change:


Improve the existing applications based on business needs and priorities
Participate in the support of the existing applications



Communicate:


Collaborate with Back-end Developers to integrate features and ensure interoperability
Provide technical support and assistance to Business Analysts and other contributors for specifications, testing and the resolution of incidents / problems
Document the codes as well as the algorithms to facilitate maintenance and knowledge transfer
Ensure and maintain effective interactions with other relevant teams
Contribute to the community of Data Scientists



Profil du candidat

We expect you to have:


A Data Scientist / Optimization Expert background with a proficiency in software development
Knowledge and experience in Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP
Proficiency in Python and its good practices
Interest for the power trading business
An ability to quickly understand the physical mechanisms for power assets (e.g.: how a battery works)
Educated to at least Masters degree level or an equivalent in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar discipline



It would be a plus if you had:


Knowledge of data and analytics, including AI/ML technologies, and their application for the power trading business
Experience in Agile methodologies and project management methodologies
Experience in a power utility or trading environment
Good skills on DevOps (Docker, Git, GitHub Actions)
Good knowledge of noSQL databases (MongoDB)
Experience with Databricks
Experience in Cloud-based environments



Your strengths

You are…


Able to solve complex problems
Rigorous
A Team player
Curious and open-minded
Dynamic and agile
Able to shift from detail-oriented to big-picture views



Languages


English : C1 level as minimum expectation
Competency in French is advantageous



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

  • Knowledge and experience in Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP
  • Proficiency in Python and its good practices
  • Interest for the power trading business
  • An ability to quickly understand the physical mechanisms for power assets (e.g.: how a battery works)
  • Educated to at least Masters degree level or an equivalent in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar discipline


It would be a plus if you had:

  • Knowledge of data and analytics, including AI/ML technologies, and their application for the power trading business
  • Experience in Agile methodologies and project management methodologies
  • Experience in a power utility or trading environment
  • Good skills on DevOps (Docker, Git, GitHub Actions)
  • Good knowledge of noSQL databases (MongoDB)
  • Experience with Databricks
  • Experience in Cloud-based environments


Your strengths

You are…

  • Able to solve complex problems
  • Rigorous
  • A Team player
  • Curious and open-minded
  • Dynamic and agile
  • Able to shift from detail-oriented to big-picture views


Languages

  • English : C1 level as minimum expectation
  • Competency in French is advantageous


Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Swarovski, where innovation meets inspiration, our people desire to explore, experience and create. As a Data Scientist you will get a chance to work in a rewarding role within a diverse team that is pushing boundaries. Be part of a truly iconic global brand, learn and grow with us. We’re bold and inventive, revealing astonishing things like no one else can. A world of wonder awaits you.

About The Job

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


Designing and developing quantitative and generative AI assets by translating business problems and requirements into actionable insights
Partnering with other Business Functions to align with market state-of-the-art solutions and identify Advanced Analytics opportunities to be embedded the existing processes
Developing data science products ensuring business improvements are impactful and aligned to the company objectives and strategy, including appropriate and structured documentation of the methodology and data used
Leverage the Data Lake information and cloud infrastructure as well as the current technology landscape to design the solutions
Selecting features, building and optimizing models using Machine Learning and other Advanced Analytics techniques
Coordinating with the Innovation reference people to identify suitable processes for AI agents, analyze them and develop AI Agents use cases
Presenting results and insights to business and driving the conversation about innovation directions in the Advanced Analytics space


About You

We are looking for a unique and amazing talent, who brings along the following:


University degree/ Education, preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or similar
Minimum 3 years of professional experience in a similar role within an international setting
Proficiency in Python and/or R, modelling & real-time analytics, database languages (e.g., SQL), big data frameworks, and Cloud platforms (e.g. Google Cloud Platform, Azure, AWS)
Deep understanding of Generative AI models their implementation in business settings
Previous experience with AI Agents (e.g. GCP Agent builder) is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Team orientation and ability to work and interface effectively with all levels of the organization
Excellent English proficiency, presentation and communication skills


What We Offer

You can expect a range of benefits, including:


Swarovski products discounts
Full coverage of accident insurance
Attractive pension fund conditions
Subsidized public transportation or free parking
Employee canteen with buffet


Masters of Light Since 1895

Swarovski creates beautiful crystal-based products of impeccable quality and craftsmanship that bring joy and celebrate individuality.

Founded in 1895 in Austria, the company designs, manufactures and sells the world's finest crystal, gemstones, Swarovski Created Diamonds and zirconia, jewelry, and accessories, as well as crystal objects and home accessories. Swarovski Crystal Business has a global reach with approximately 2,400 stores and 6,700 points of sales in around 140 countries and employs more than 18,000 people. Together with its sister companies Swarovski Optik (optical devices) and Tyrolit (abrasives), Swarovski Crystal Business forms the Swarovski Group. A responsible relationship with people and the planet is part of Swarovski’s heritage. Today this legacy is rooted in sustainability measures across the value chain, with an emphasis on circular innovation, championing diversity, inclusion and self-expression, and in the philanthropic work of the Swarovski Foundation, which supports charitable organizations bringing positive environmental and social impact.

Swarovski is an equal opportunity employer. We give our people the guts to celebrate individuality and pride ourselves on creating a workplace where people feel involved, respected, valued, connected, and heard. A place where anyone/everyone belongs. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under the law of the countries we operate in.


Show more

Title: Data Scientist- 80-100%
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Scientist who is passionate about developing AI systems using Unique AI’s SDK. In this role, you will focus on building and improving vertical use cases in the financial industry, helping us unlock the full potential of GenAI for our customers. You will work closely with our product and engineering teams to design, prototype, and develop AI Agents and systems that deliver real business impact.

Job Requirements

What you need to succeed


Hands-on experience with LLMs, including tool calling and low-level experimentation beyond frameworks, as well as prompt engineering for customer use cases
Solid understanding of AI systems and their functionalities, such as deep research and other applied AI techniques, combined with strong Python coding skills to translate these concepts into production-ready workflows and maintain robust AI pipelines
Proven experience in developing and deploying GenAI solutions in production environments; hands-on experience with AI Agents is a plus
Exceptional communication and documentation skills
4+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or a related field


Job Benefits

What we offer


Competitive salary 💰
Innovative Work Environment 🚀 Engage in groundbreaking projects within the Generative AI space with real-world impact in the financial sector
Leading Company 💪 A chance to be part of a leading company in a rapidly evolving industry
Culture 🌿 A modern company with flat hierarchies that focuses on a people-oriented culture and places great emphasis on transparency and open communication
Global Team 🌎 Collaborate with our offices in Switzerland, London, Berlin, and Singapore
Travel Opportunities ✈️ Experience travel across US, working directly with diverse clients

Title: Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect
Description:
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect is responsible for building, deploying, and scaling advanced machine learning (ML) and optimization models on AWS to solve high-impact business problems in supply chain management. This role requires someone with a deep understanding of cloud-based technologies, capable of enhancing existing code and improving model performance. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, enhance existing cloud-based pipelines, and ensure smooth operation of production models. Additionally, you will contribute to automating KPI reports and support data-driven decision-making across the business.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Advanced Data Science Models: Apply statistical and machine learning models to supply chain management, with a focus on improving cost-efficiency and customer satisfaction.
AI & ML Systems: Develop and deploy AI/ML systems for process optimization, such as scheduling problems, and simulate various delivery scenarios.
Cloud-Based Enhancements: Enhance existing cloud-based data science solutions, implement new ML algorithms, and perform rigorous benchmarking to improve performance.
AWS Cloud Integration: Work with AWS cloud tools (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, etc.) to develop and deploy scalable AI/ML pipelines.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and visualize data to derive actionable business insights and improve workflows.
KPI Automation: Design, prepare, and automate KPI reports to support strategic decision-making.
Monitoring & Validation: Write test and validation scripts to monitor cloud performance, data latency, and ensure data output quality.
Collaboration: Collaborate with product managers, engineering teams, and business stakeholders to align solutions with operational and business goals.
Documentation: Ensure comprehensive documentation of data processes, modeling strategies, and system designs to facilitate knowledge transfer and system maintainability.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, AI, and cloud technologies to continuously improve the organization's analytical capabilities.




PROFILE




Education:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).

Work Experience:

5+ years of hands-on experience in data science, AI/ML.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Advanced experience with machine learning libraries.
Deep knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and optimization methods.
Experience with AWS technologies (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, Glue, Athena, etc.).
Experience working on optimization and scheduling (Python libraries preferred).
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
Knowledge of CI/CD practices for data workflows.
Experience in supply chain management.
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code.

Travel Requirements:

Occasional travel may be required for business needs.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a Data Scientist at QuantumBlack, you will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

In this role, you will be responsible for working on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world’s largest organizations to solve real-world problems. You will develop high-quality data science products and solutions for clients as well as assets for our internal data teams, focusing on modeling and working alongside the Data Engineering team. Additionally, you will present findings, recommendations, and provide consultation to stakeholders, both internal and clients.

Throughout your tenure, you will learn to work across various industries and sectors, gaining insights into diverse business challenges and applications of data science. You will build large-scale data and analytics solutions, handling complex problems and advanced client situations. You will also learn best practices in data and analytics development, including framework, responsibility model, high-quality code, data security, sustainability, and scalability. Working in collaborative teams with diverse skill sets, you will foster effective teamwork and learn from colleagues in a multicultural and creative environment. Staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science tools, techniques, and technologies, as well as participating in first-class learning programs, will be a key part of your development. You will also develop strong client-facing skills, including effective communication, problem-solving, and presentation abilities.

You will work with other data scientists, data/ML engineers, designers, project managers, and business subject matter experts on interdisciplinary projects across various industry sectors to enable business ambitions with data and analytics.

In terms of who you are, you are a highly collaborative individual capable of setting aside your own agenda to listen to and learn from colleagues. You challenge thoughtfully and prioritize impact. You constantly seek ways to improve and work collaboratively with others. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning, and improving to move forward quickly.

Our tech stack is diverse. While we advocate for using the right tools for the right task, we also take into account the client’s current landscape and preferences. Often, we use Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Databricks, SQL, Docker, and Kubernetes. We also leverage our own proprietary tools such as Kedro, CausalNex, and MLRun. We work on a regular basis with cloud service providers such as AWS, GCP, and Azure.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in (business) math, statistics, machine learning, data science, physics, computer science or engineering required
Master's degree or PhD level in the field of data science, computer science, business informatics or equivalent is a plus
Up to 2 years of professional hands-on experience in applying advanced data science methods and implementing technical data solutions (e.g. develop machine learning models), in order to solve business problems
A strong grasp of various analytics landscape, including business intelligence, machine learning, AI, and generative AI, and how to apply them effectively in different scenarios
Proficiency in Python, SQL (focus on data & analytics applications)
Professional experience in cloud-based analytical tools from market-leading providers such as AWS, MS Azure, Google Cloud
Proficient communication skills in German and English
Effective communication and presentation skills, particularly the ability to explain complex analytical concepts in a comprehensible manner adapted to different groups of non-technical audiences e.g. business managers, heads of products, sales & marketing leads
Practical experience in generative AI application development
Proven record of advisory works
Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
Show more

  • Proficiency in Python, SQL (focus on data & analytics applications)
  • Professional experience in cloud-based analytical tools from market-leading providers such as AWS, MS Azure, Google Cloud

  • Practical experience in generative AI application development
  • Proven record of advisory works
  • Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities

Title: Data Science Expert - Formulation & digital transformation
Description:
Be the backbone of innovation and join a leading pharmaceutical company to help keep life-changing science moving forward!

Proclinical is seeking a Data Science Expert - Formulation & digital transformation to support digital transformation initiatives in the development of innovative solid drug delivery platforms. This role bridges formulation workflow optimization with data and digital projects, offering an exciting opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge advancements in pharmaceutical manufacturing. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to refine data handling methodologies, develop robust data strategies, and ensure adherence to best practices and standards.

Please note that to be considered for this role you must have the right to work in this location or hold an EU passport.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with formulation and manufacturing experts to design effective data strategies for unit operations.
Support digital transformation projects by implementing advanced, data-centric approaches.
Contribute to the development of guidelines for data handling, ensuring compliance with standards and procedures.
Liaise with manufacturing site teams, system owners, and business process owners to manage data effectively.
Collect and summarize user feedback on data applications to improve data handling processes.
Compile and visualize experimental data, contributing to comprehensive development reports.
Review development and manufacturing documents, performing thorough data integrity checks.
Promote a culture of learning and collaboration by sharing best practices across digitalization projects.

Key Skills and Requirements:

Advanced degree (Master's or equivalent) in a relevant scientific field.
Proficiency in structuring, wrangling, and engineering data.
Experience with manufacturing processes for pharmaceutical oral dosage forms.
Strong interdisciplinary thinking and ability to collaborate across functions.
Excellent communication and technical writing skills.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

If you are having difficulty in applying or if you have any questions, please contact Ashley Bennett at a.bennett@proclinical.com.



Apply Now:

If you are interested in applying to this exciting opportunity, then please click 'Apply' or to speak to one of our specialists please request a call back at the top of this page.

Proclinical is a leading life sciences recruiter focused on finding exceptional people and matching them with the finest positions across the globe. Proclinical is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

By submitting this application, you confirm that you've read and understood our privacy policy, which informs you how we process and safeguard your data - https://www.proclinical.com/privacy-policy

Title: AI and Optimization Engineer
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution.

Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

The team is within the Modelling and Analysis for Trading Strategy (MATS) department, which is responsible for the end-to-end design and development of comprehensive quantitative models, state-of-the-art analytical and AI tools, and research that help optimize trading decisions across all TGP trading desks. Positioned at the strategic interface between Trading, Risk Management and IT, it guarantees the agility, robustness and continuous innovation of the algorithms driving TGP market strategy.

We are looking for our new AI and Optimization Engineer. This position is based in Geneva and reports to the Manager AI & Quant Development (N+1) and the VP MATS (N+2). The role is part of the Gas Trading Division within the Gas Renewables & Power branch.

Activités


You will be at the forefront of development of scalable, reusable, and intelligent frameworks that drive long-term P&L growth, ensuring they are built as maintainable, long-living, production-grade solutions.
You will build extensible frameworks that evolve with business needs and are used across different trading desks.
You will iteratively enhance these frameworks to support rapid feature delivery while minimizing technical debt and ensuring long-term maintainability.
You will develop and maintain production-grade Auto‑ML libraries for time series forecasting, enabling rapid, high-quality model development with robust support for data processing, feature engineering, model selection, and deployment.
You will provide expert support to users (data scientists from MATS teams and traders) by leveraging your comprehensive understanding of the frameworks developed in the team. You will facilitate their work by clearly presenting the features and guiding them to fully utilize the capabilities of the frameworks, ensuring they can maximize their potential.
You will collaborate with key partner teams (e.g. Algo Strategies, Modelling & Analysis) to co-develop specialized tools, ensuring flexibility for researchers while maintaining core architectural standards.
You will work on a variety of different problems related to energy and commodity markets and acquire business knowledge.



Your key responsibilities will include:


Taking ownership of the products and helping implement processes to guarantee a successful deployment.
Be conscientious of and promote best development practices to ensure quality and robustness of usage.
Create accompanying applications (such as for interactive visualization and simulations) to facilitate user understanding and interaction with the core frameworks.
Ensure adherence to the product life cycle, including all phases from initial concept through to product release and post-release activities.
Test and integrate advanced techniques and quantitative algorithms, with a focus on continuous improvement.
Oversee the frameworks, monitor performance (both in terms of results and computational efficiency), and proactively implement enhancements based on analytical findings.
Ensure comprehensive documentation is created and maintained for all frameworks, to guide users in utilizing these applications effectively.
Frequently communicate with the core teams of MATS and trading desks to ensure solid business knowledge, understanding of trading desk activities, challenges, and pain points.



Profil du candidat


You are a talented individual with a strong technical or engineering background. A PhD in Computer Science or Physics is an advantage.
You are a continuous learner with a strong team spirit, always seeking to improve and innovate beyond the status quo. An individual who demonstrates the ability to adapt and successfully collaborate with colleagues from di-verse backgrounds, and likes proactively sharing acquired knowledge.
5+ years of proven experience in software development and/or maintenance, and working with large code-bases. Must be able to write scalable, well-tested and well-documented code that adheres to best practices, and is pre-pared for future use cases. Experience debugging and safe refactoring legacy code is required.
You show a strong understanding of Data Science, ML, and algorithmic methods, with demonstrated experience working with a diverse array of algorithms (time series forecasting, AutoML, constrained optimization, matching, anomaly detection, etc.). Experience in developing quantitative algorithms is an advantage.
You have interest or familiarity with energy and commodities markets, and ability to develop appropriate algorithms (use cases such as backtesting, portfolio optimization, physical and financial assets pricing, dispatch optimization, etc.)
Mindset to design extensible and reusable code according to business needs.
Experience with product cycle (development, validation, deployment).
Experience with cloud computing, DevOps/MLOps best practices, CI/CD, and containerization.
Knowledge of relational and non-relational databases (SQL, MongoDB).
Clear and effective communication skills for reporting and collaboration.
You are fluent in English or French native/fluent speaker with an advanced English level.



Additional and advantageous requirements:


Experience with concurrent programming (multiprocessing, multithreading, gpu-acceleration).
Demonstrated contributions to open-source projects.
Experience with AWS and Databricks.



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Autonomy Engineer - AI & ML
Description:
Do you want to dive into the fast-growing industry of drones and get a rewarding experience in a dynamic start-up environment?




At Flyability, we believe that robots should be sent into hazardous places and dangerous situations instead of humans. To support our belief, we created Elios, the world's first collision-tolerant flying robot that for the first time allows remote entry to complex and indoor spaces. With more than 100 employees, Flyability is the pioneer in the UAV indoor inspection industry. Joining Flyability is not just taking on a new job, it is seizing the opportunity to improve the life of millions of people and build the future of robotics.




To complete our creative and dynamic team in Lausanne, we are seeking an:

Autonomy Engineer - AI & ML

Starting date: as soon as possible




Your role:

You will lead the data-driven side of our AI development, shaping how we collect, label, and use data to train models that generalize in real-world conditions. Beyond data, you will contribute to model selection, evaluation, and integration, helping ensure these models connect meaningfully with our autonomy systems.

This role involves close collaboration with our teams to develop and maintain the interfaces and logic required to execute complex robotic tasks.




What you will own:

Design and implementation of training pipelines, including dataset structuring, labeling strategies, and simulation integration
Specialization and adaptation of foundation models, including large language models (LLMs), using techniques like fine-tuning, RAG, and vector database integration
Development of robust evaluation pipelines for both conventional models and LLMs, including stratified test sets, error analysis, and performance tracking
Integration of trained models into execution pipelines in collaboration with our other teams




Requirements




Your profile:

3+ years of experience training and tuning deep learning models on real or simulated data
Solid understanding of how data quality, diversity, and labeling influence model behavior and generalization
Experience analyzing training dynamics, debugging performance issues, and tuning hyperparameters
Proficient in Python and modern ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Experience integrating ML models into larger systems or pipelines, ideally in robotics or embedded contexts




Flyability is a young Swiss company that values independent thinking combined with a collaborative spirit. Every day, you will have the opportunity to share your ideas and contribute to solving problems. We all work together, and each voice is important to move forward.




We know the confidence gap and impostor syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply - regardless of your past experience or resume, we'd love to hear from you.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Laine




Laine Neural Network SA is a LegalTech company developing an international terminal that automates legal drafting through generative AI and machine learning, aimed at connecting end-users with licensed lawyers.




Role Description

The Senior Machine Learning Engineer will be responsible for developing and optimizing machine learning models, implementing neural networks, and conducting pattern recognition and statistical analysis. The role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to enhance AI-driven solutions and contribute to the continuous improvement of the platform.




Qualifications




Experience in Pattern Recognition and Neural Networks
Strong background in deep learning (PyTorch, TensorFlow) and modern ML workflows
Proven experience with AI agents (e.g., LangChain, Auto-GPT, OpenAI APIs, ReAct, or similar frameworks)
Strong background in Computer Science and Algorithms
Proven experience with AI agents (e.g., LangChain, Auto-GPT, OpenAI APIs, ReAct, or similar frameworks)
Proficiency in Statistics and applied statistical analysis
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively
Advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Experience in the legal tech industry is a plus
Strong communication skills in English
Based in Switzerland or authorized to work there




Successful candidates must be willing to learn further and develop their Machine Learning skills. They must also work with a team based in Geneva, Switzerland, Ghent, Belgium, and Dubai, UAE. They must be proactive and have a ‘can-do’ attitude. We are looking for good team players. If you have an interest in the intersection of law, technology, and AI and meet the criteria above, we invite you to apply.







Send your applications to recruitment@laine.ai.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Project Description:

We are looking for an experienced specialist to work for one of our client from the banking industry.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement advanced machine learning and deep learning models tailored to complex financial datasets and business objectives.
Apply statistical and mathematical methods to analyze data trends, assess risk, and inform predictive modeling.
Evaluate, validate, and monitor model performance, ensuring accuracy, stability, and regulatory compliance.
Collaborate with financial analysts, IT teams, and data scientists to align models with operational and strategic goals.
Translate technical results into actionable insights through clear visualizations and communication to non-technical stakeholders.
Stay current on evolving financial regulations, market developments, and innovations in AI applications for the banking sector.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Strong foundation in statistics, probability, and linear algebra, essential for developing interpretable and robust models.
Deep expertise in Python and R, with hands-on experience using libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Pandas.
Solid understanding of financial markets, instruments, and regulatory frameworks, enabling informed model development and deployment.
Proven ability to evaluate and validate models for fairness, accuracy, and real-world relevance.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with experience presenting to business leaders and cross-functional stakeholders.
Experience with deep learning frameworks, NLP, and time-series forecasting in financial contexts is highly desirable.




Languages:

English: C1 Advanced

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Join our Data Science and Engineering team to build impactful Machine Learning solutions. Work on projects like fine-tuning models, recommendation systems, and forecasting. Optimize pipelines, improve MLOps, and ensure scalable, reliable systems. Ready to make a difference? We’d love to hear from you!

What impact do you have?


Foster a hands-on, collaborative environment with Data Analysts, Software Engineers, and Product Managers— turning exploratory insights into ML-ready assets.
Ensure that machine learning solutions are aligned with clear business objectives so that downstream model development delivers tangible value for customers and the company.
Deliver innovative solutions by fine-tuning state-of-the-art transformer and LLM, building robust recommendation systems, or tackling practical predictive tasks such as demand forecasting.
Working closely with product teams, you iterate quickly to ship high-quality services that create measurable business impact.
Drive continuous improvement of our machine learning pipelines by implementing robust training workflows and automation.
Advance our MLOps capabilities by refining deployment processes and leveraging modern CI/CD and model monitoring tools to ensure our production systems are reliable and scalable.


What do you offer?


Education: Master's degree (university / university of applied science) Machine Learning, Computer Science, or a related field
Experience: 3-5 Years Hands-on experience delivering ML models end-to-end (from development to production)
You are proactive and curious, boldly challenge assumptions to drive progress, yet remain open to feedback and thrive on constructive dialogue.
Proficient in modern machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, XGBoost, and Hugging Face Transformers.
Familiarity with MLOps best practices (e.g. CI/CD pipelines, containerization, model monitoring) and a drive to continually improve our deployment processes for scalable and reproducible ML outcomes.
Hands-on experience deploying machine learning solutions on Cloud (GCP Vertex AI, AzureI). Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code tools is a plus.
Data engineering skills (such as building data pipelines and handling large datasets) are a plus, as they enable seamless integration of data into our machine learning workflows.
English (B2)
French (ADVANTAGEOUS)


What do we offer you?


Maternity/paternity leave: 18-week maternity leave paid at 100% and 4-week paternity leave paid at 100%
Mobile phone subscription: Cell phone subscription at attractive rates
Catering: A company restaurant is available for employees to eat at preferential rates
Cumulus points: Benefit from additional Cumulus points
Sports and fitness offers: We value your health and offer CHF 250.- per year when taking out a sports subscription
Individual continuing training: We value your development and participate in your growth and offer a budget for it
Informal culture: We stand for respectful cooperation on the same level
Personal responsibility & freedom: We value direct communication and involve our employees in the decision-making process


Only online applications can be accepted on the applications portal.

Recruitment process


Submit application documents
Pre-selection of applications
Interview with HR & specialist department
Getting to know the team
Offer & issuance of the contract (digital)


Contact

Ms. Katharina Höttermann

Talent Acquisition Partner

No suitable vacancies?

Set up a search subscription to ensure you receive suitable job vacancies conveniently by e-mail. Set up a job subscription

Title: Data Scientist Commodities - Trading – Poste en client final (Hedge Fund) – CDI – Genève
Description:
La société :




Fond gérant plus 15 milliards dollars. Les 700 collaborateurs sont répartis dans les bureaux en plein centre de Paris ainsi qu’à Londres, Hong Kong et New York.




En croissance permanente, la société prône des valeurs fortes tels que l’investissement et l’engagement.




Notre client recherche un Data Scientist Commodities qui interviendra directement auprès des équipes de quant researchers et de traders.




Vos missions :




Rechercher et intégrer de nouveaux jeux de données en cohérence avec les besoins stratégiques des desks de trading.
Acquérir une expertise approfondie des outils internes pour accompagner les équipes de trading dans l’utilisation efficace des données au sein des systèmes de production.
Anticiper et résoudre les problématiques liées aux données afin de réduire au maximum les délais de mise en production.
Prendre en charge l’ensemble des étapes des projets liés aux données – de l’acquisition à la mise en production – en passant par l’exploration, l’ingénierie et le prototypage.




Profil recherché :




Ecole d’ingénieur
Minimum 3 années d’expérience professionnelle en tant que Data Scientist dans la finance
Expertise : Python, NumPy et Pandas
Expérience en finance de marché
Excellentes capacités de résolution de problèmes
Excellentes compétences en communication
Anglais courant




Package proposé :




Salaire fixe : supérieur à la moyenne du marché
Bonus
Intéressement
2 jours de TT par semaine




Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus, envoyez-moi votre profil.




Paul Boulan

MR SEARCH

Title: Data Scientist 80-100%
Description:
Für unser Team Customer Analytics im Geschäftsbereich Club suchen wir per 1. November 2025 oder nach Vereinbarung am Standort Ostermundigen BE eine dynamische, engagierte und zielorientierte Persönlichkeit als Data Scientist.




Das können Sie bewegen

Extraktion, Analyse und Modellierung von Daten zur Unterstützung von Produktmanagement, Customer Experience, Marketing und Kampagnenmanagement
Erstellung, Validierung und laufende Optimierung von Affinity-Scores
Entwicklung von Predictive Models mit Hilfe moderner Machine-Learning-Methoden
Pflege und Weiterentwicklung von Datenpipelines und ETL-Prozessen
Visualisierung und Kommunikation komplexer Zusammenhänge mittels BI-Tools und zielgruppengerechtem Storytelling
Interpretation der Resultate und Ableitung datenbasierter Empfehlungen für Entscheidungsprozesse
Mitarbeit in bereichsübergreifenden Projekten, insbesondere bei der Integration neuer Datenquellen und Modellentwicklung
Analyse von Kampagnen und Unterstützung bei der Zielgruppendefinition




Damit gelingt Ihnen der Einstieg

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in Data Analytics und Machine Learning (z. B. Klassifikation, Regression, Clustering)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie Erfahrung mit Python
Erfahrung mit Statistik- und Analyseplattformen wie SAS Viya, Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools
Verständnis für Datenmodellierung, Feature Engineering und Modellbewertung
Fähigkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen verständlich und zielgerichtet zu präsentieren
Hohe Kundenorientierung, Eigenverantwortung und Freude an interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse, gute Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil




Darauf können Sie sich freuen

Zentraler Arbeitsort mit guter ÖV-Anbindung
Moderner Arbeitsplatz
Internes Präventions- und Fitnessprogramm (Yoga, Pilates etc.)
Ein angenehmes und offenes Arbeitsklima sowie zeitgemässe Anstellungsbedingungen




Interessiert? Dann bewerben Sie sich noch heute und schreiben Sie mit uns TCS-Geschichte.




Beim TCS schätzen und respektieren wir vielfältige Lebenswege und die Diversität der Profile unserer Mitarbeitenden. Gleichbehandlung hat für uns oberste Priorität.




Francine Hänni, HR Business Partner, gibt Ihnen unter +41 58 827 30 05 gerne Auskunft zur Stelle.




Deshalb gibt es uns seit über 125 Jahren: Rund um den TCS Schweiz - TCS Schweiz

Das können Sie bewegen

  • Extraktion, Analyse und Modellierung von Daten zur Unterstützung von Produktmanagement, Customer Experience, Marketing und Kampagnenmanagement
  • Erstellung, Validierung und laufende Optimierung von Affinity-Scores
  • Entwicklung von Predictive Models mit Hilfe moderner Machine-Learning-Methoden
  • Pflege und Weiterentwicklung von Datenpipelines und ETL-Prozessen
  • Visualisierung und Kommunikation komplexer Zusammenhänge mittels BI-Tools und zielgruppengerechtem Storytelling
  • Interpretation der Resultate und Ableitung datenbasierter Empfehlungen für Entscheidungsprozesse
  • Mitarbeit in bereichsübergreifenden Projekten, insbesondere bei der Integration neuer Datenquellen und Modellentwicklung
  • Analyse von Kampagnen und Unterstützung bei der Zielgruppendefinition


Damit gelingt Ihnen der Einstieg

Title: Software Engineer, ML & Data Platforms (100%)
Description:
Your mission

You’re passionate about Applied Machine Learning and eager to apply your skills in a real-world setting. At PXL Vision, you’ll join our Core Technology Team, contributing to innovative solutions in biometrics and document scanning. You’ll collaborate with experienced engineers to build scalable, reliable systems that shape the future of identity verification and power PXL Vision’s digital identity platform.

Trusted Role: Yes, high security clearance

What You Bring


Collaborate on the development and optimisation of infrastructure to evaluate computer vision solutions at scale
Help monitor and improve the performance of our identity verification systems in production
Build and enhance Machine Learning pipelines and support the integration of ML solutions into our products
Design and manage data pipelines for training and evaluation of ML models
Address real-world data challenges, including data taxonomy and preprocessing
Work closely with product and operations teams to align technical work with business goals
Contribute ideas and take part in building our next-generation technology


Requirements


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Min. 2 years of experience in software development in Python, with a focus on Machine Learning and d
ata engineering.
SQL skills, including writing complex queries and tuning performance.
You're motivated to improve your technical skills
Excellent problem-solving, analytical skills and excellent command of English.
Familiarity with other programming languages such as C++ or Java is a plus.


Why us?


Flexible working hours & hybrid location model
You can help shape things with us and fully contribute your creativity
We are enthusiastic, international and a diverse team with a flat hierarchy
Annual training/further education budget of up to EUR 1,500
Language courses budget up to EUR 1'500


About Us

PXL Vision is the Swiss market leader and premium provider of identity verification for companies. Based on artificial intelligence, PXL Vision offers a highly flexible, modular and configurable software platform for secure and fully automated identity verification to meet complex requirements worldwide.

We aim to develop innovative, secure and reliable identity verification solutions, always with our customers in mind.

The company is headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and operates throughout Europe.

Title: Data Scientist / Consultant - Internship
Description:
AI brings huge potential, but many companies are still struggling to release the desired impact. We are a pragmatic and dynamic team to help “accelerating impact with Data Science” for our business clients. You as a talent are needed to rapidly grow our business which started up from three founders with proven track-records in AI consulting and scaled AI implementations.

For our powerful team, we are offering an internship as Swiss based Data Science Consultant supporting our German and French speaking customer's realizing AI solutions.

Your mission


Add real-world impact by helping to transform our clients’ data into tangible business value
Pragmatically contribute to design, implement, and deploy AI solutions with “best in class” open-source technology to solve pressing business problems
Act in a high-performing, agile delivery team and take accountability for key tasks across the full project life cycle – from business development to solution design to delivery to consulting and communication
Build trusted relationship with various stakeholders across our clients, delivery teams and partners



What You Can Expect


An adventure with great talents that want to change the future with AI
An environment in which you can grow, contribute, and shape with your ideas
A flexible working model to match academic activities
Further shape the start-up and help for fast growths
A great team and great experiences while delivering fascinating projects with well-known Swiss clients



About Artifact

Artifact is dedicated to empower people with AI for the better. As a professional service provider, we do Data Science. Together, we are leveraging the best ideas to find pragmatic and sophisticated solutions with the best suited technology. We help our business clients to accelerate their journey with AI and deliver real impact. We have innovation in our minds, people in our hearts and agility in our veins.

Your profile


You have already achieved your Bachelor’s degree and have a current inscription for an Master’s degree or PhD in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related STEM field
Fascination & hands-on experience in Data Science work with understanding of Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP) or Computer Vision
Proficiency in Python and preferably additional languages such as R or SQL and initial experience with analytics libraries, visualization tools and Big Data frameworks
Outstanding comprehension capability and structured thinking / working approach to consult our clients for best solutions and approaches
Remarkable interpersonal skills paired with a relentless eager to learn and grow
Excellent written and oral communication (English and German or French is a must)
Openness and willingness to move out of your comfort zone
Open minded and a good sense of humor
You have a valid work permit in Switzerland
You intend to start your new job @Artifact within the next 90-120 days from your point of application
